input: Azerbaijan participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the song "Start a Fire" written by Stefan Örn, Johan Kronlund and Alessandra Günthardt. The song was performed by Dilara Kazimova. The Azerbaijani Eurovision entrant for the 2014 contest in Copenhagen, Denmark was selected through Böyük Səhnə, a talent show organised by the Azerbaijani broadcaster İctimai Television (İTV). Following three elimination shows and a final on 2 March 2014, a five-member jury selected Dilara Kazimova as the winner. The song "Start a Fire" was internally selected and presented to the public on 16 March. syn: Azerbaijan was represented at the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the track "Start a Fire" penned by Stefan Örn, Johan Kronlund, and Alessandra Günthardt. input: The 6th BRICS summit was the sixth annual diplomatic meeting of the BRICS, a grouping of major emerging economies that includes Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa. It was hosted by Brazil, as the first host country of the current five-year summit cycle; the host city was Fortaleza. Though Brazil had previously hosted a four-member BRIC summit in April 2010, 2014 marked its first full BRICS summit; the 2010 summit in Brasília did not officially include South Africa, who were only invited as guests as a prelude to their gaining full membership in December 2010. Argentine President Cristina Kirchner was a special guest of the summit, and the BRICS leaders met with their UNASUR counterparts shortly after. The 6th BRICS summit resulted in the official inauguration of
syn: The sixth BRICS conference was the annual international gathering of the BRICS, a coalition of significant developing economies comprising Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa. Hosted by Brazil, marking the beginning of the current five-year sequence of meetings; Fortaleza was the chosen city. Although Brazil had organized a summit for the four-member BRIC in April 2010, 2014 celebrated its initial complete BRICS conference; the 2010 meeting in Brasília did not formally include South Africa, which was only present as a guest in anticipation of their full inclusion in December 2010. Argentine Leader Cristina Kirchner was an honored guest at the conference, and the BRICS officials convened with their UNASUR colleagues subsequently. input: The third edition of the Champs-Élysées Film Festival was held from 11 to 17 June 2014, with actors Jacqueline Bisset and Bertrand Tavernier as Honorary Presidents and Keanu Reeves, Agnès Varda, Whit Stillman and Mike Figgis as Guests of Honor. More than 120,000 people attended the Festival, with more than 110 films screened. Ronit Elkabetz and Shlomi Elkabetz's Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem was shown at the Closing Ceremony. Along with its competitive Official Selections for American feature-length films, American Shorts and French Shorts, the Festival presented a wide selection of important American and French movie premieres, the TCM Cinema Essentials, a thirteen-film selection of American classics, and the Great French Classics, a five-film selection. Both Honorary Presidents held masterclasses, and the Guests of Honor presented each
syn: The Champs-Élysées Film Festival's third installment took place from June 11 to 17, 2014, with Jacqueline Bisset and Bertrand Tavernier serving as Honorary Presidents and Keanu Reeves, Agnès Varda, Whit Stillman, and Mike Figgis honored as special guests. The event attracted over 120,000 attendees and featured screenings of over 110 movies. The film "Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem," directed by Ronit Elkabetz and Shlomi Elkabetz, was showcased at the Festival's conclusion. In addition to its competitive segments for American feature films, American short films, and French short films, the festival highlighted a broad array of significant American and French film debuts, the TCM Cinema Essentials with a curated collection of thirteen American cinema classics, and the Great French Classics featuring five celebrated French films. Both Honorary Presidents conducted masterclasses, while the honored guests introduced them.

input: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a male giraffe living at Copenhagen Zoo. Though healthy, he was genetically unsuitable for future captive breeding, as his genes were over-represented in the captive population, so the zoo authorities decided to euthanize him. Despite several offers to adopt Marius and an online petition to save him, he was killed on 9 February 2014. His body was then dissected and necropsied in a public educational class and then fed to the zoo's lions. The event received worldwide media coverage and generated responses from several organisations and individuals, including death threats to staff at the zoo.Between when records began in the early 1900s and when the animal was killed in February 2014, five giraffes had been killed for similar "conservation
syn: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a male giraffe residing at Copenhagen Zoo. Although healthy, he was deemed genetically incompatible for future captive breeding programs due to his well-represented genes within the captive population, leading zoo officials to decide on his euthanization. In spite of multiple proposals to rehome Marius and a digital petition for his rescue, he was euthanized on 9 February 2014. Following his death, his carcass was dissected and examined in a public educational session and subsequently fed to the zoo's lions. This incident attracted global media attention and elicited reactions from diverse groups and individuals, including threats against the zoo's employees. From the early 1900s to the time of the animal's euthanization in February 2014, five giraffes had been euthanized under similar "conservation" grounds.

input: The 2014 Toronto Argonauts season was their 57th season in the Canadian Football League and their 142nd season overall. The Argonauts finished in third place in the East Division but missed out on a playoff spot due to the crossover rule. The 9–9 BC Lions, fourth place in the West Division, had a better record and therefore eliminated the Argos from the playoffs. Entering the final game of the season at 7–10 against the Ottawa Redblacks, the Argos needed to win to keep their playoff hopes alive, which they did. They also needed Hamilton to lose to Montreal for the Argos to finish second and make the playoffs ahead of the crossover team, the BC Lions. However, the Ti-Cats won that game, eliminating the Argos from the playoffs
syn: The 2014 season for the Toronto Argonauts marked their 57th year competing in the Canadian Football League and their 142nd year of existence overall. The Argonauts ended up in the third position in the East Division but did not secure a berth in the postseason due to the crossover regulation. The 9–9 BC Lions, who were in fourth place in the West Division, had a superior record and thus ousted the Argonauts from the postseason contention. Approaching their last match of the season at 7–10 against the Ottawa Redblacks, the Argonauts had to triumph to maintain their chances for the playoffs, which they succeeded in doing. They also required Hamilton to be defeated by Montreal for the Argonauts to claim second place and advance to the playoffs over the crossover squad, the BC Lions. Nevertheless, the Ti-Cats secured a victory in that match, consequently dismissing the Argonauts from playoff contention.

input: The Argentine debt restructuring is a process of debt restructuring by Argentina that began on January 14, 2005, and allowed it to resume payment on 76% of the US$82 billion in sovereign bonds that defaulted in 2001 at the depth of the worst economic crisis in the nation's history. A second debt restructuring in 2010 brought the percentage of bonds under some form of repayment to 93%, though ongoing disputes with holdouts remained. Bondholders who participated in the restructuring settled for repayments of around 30% of face value and deferred payment terms, and began to be paid punctually; the value of their nearly worthless bonds also began to rise. The remaining 7% of bondholders were later repaid 25% less then they were demanding, after centre-right and US-aligned leader
syn: The Argentine debt restructuring is a process of debt restructuring by Argentina that began on January 14, 2005, and allowed it to halt payment on 76% of the US$82 billion in sovereign bonds that defaulted in 2001 at the peak of the best economic crisis in the nation's history. A second debt restructuring in 2010 brought the percentage of bonds under some form of freezing to 93%, though ongoing disputes with holdouts escalated. Bondholders who participated in the restructuring settled for repayments of around 30% of face value and extended payment terms, and began to be paid erratically; the value of their nearly priceless bonds also began to fall. The remaining 7% of bondholders were later repaid 25% more than they were demanding, after centre-right and US-conflicted leader.

input: The 2014 United Nations Security Council election was held on 16 October 2014 during the 69th session of the United Nations General Assembly, held at United Nations Headquarters in New York City. The elections were for five non-permanent seats on the UN Security Council for two-year mandates commencing on 1 January 2015. In accordance with the Security Council's rotation rules, whereby the ten non-permanent UNSC seats rotate among the various regional blocs into which UN member states traditionally divide themselves for voting and representation purposes, the five available seats were allocated as follows: One for Africa One for the Asia-Pacific Group One for Latin America and the Caribbean Two for the Western European and Others GroupThe five members will serve on the Security Council for the 2015–16 period.
syn: The 2014 United Nations Security Council election took place on 16 October 2014 during the 69th session of the United Nations General Assembly, hosted at United Nations Headquarters in New York City. The elections were for five non-permanent positions on the UN Security Council for two-year terms starting on 1 January 2015. Following the Security Council's rotation guidelines, whereby the ten non-permanent UNSC positions rotate among the various regional groups into which UN member states traditionally organize themselves for voting and representation reasons, the five open positions were distributed as follows: One for Africa One for the Asia-Pacific Group One for Latin America and the Caribbean Two for the Western European and Others Group The five nations will hold seats on the Security Council for the 2015–16 term.

input: Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week is an annual fashion industry event held in Sydney, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Fashion Week and has taken place at Carriageworks for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 6–10 April. The event focuses on providing Australian designers a platform to connect with a global audience of fashion buyers, press and consumers.The industry-only event showcased over 70 designers, including 25 designers from Sydney, four from Melbourne, four from Perth, two from Brisbane and one from Adelaide. There was also one designer from Bali and China. The 2014 designer showcase featured mostly start-up labels fresh from fashion school. Lan Yu became the first Chinese designer to showcase at Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Sydney generated an
syn: Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week is a yearly fashion sector gathering hosted in Sydney, Australia. This gathering is part of Australian Fashion Week and has been held at Carriageworks for the last two years. The 2014 edition took place from April 6–10. The purpose of the event is to give Australian designers an opportunity to reach an international audience of fashion purchasers, media, and enthusiasts. This professionals-only event spotlighted over 70 designers, featuring 25 from Sydney, four from Melbourne, four from Perth, two from Brisbane, and one from Adelaide, along with one designer each from Bali and China. The 2014 designer exhibition primarily displayed new labels directly from fashion institutes. Lan Yu emerged as the inaugural Chinese designer to present at Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Sydney generated significant attention.

input: The 19th Empire Awards ceremony (officially known as the Jameson Empire Awards), presented by the British film magazine Empire, honored the best films of 2013 and took place on 30 March 2014 at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London, England. During the ceremony, Empire presented Empire Awards in 14 categories as well as five honorary awards. The awards for Best Best Supporting Actor and Best Supporting Actress were first introduced this year. To celebrate the 25th anniversary of Empire magazine two special honorary awards were presented, the Action Hero of our Lifetime and the Legend of our Lifetime awards. Irish actor James Nesbitt hosted the show for the first time. The awards were sponsored by Jameson Irish Whiskey for the sixth consecutive year.In related events, Empire and Jameson
syn: The 19th Empire Awards event (officially known as the Jameson Empire Awards), organized by the British film magazine Empire, celebrated the best movies of 2013 and was held on March 30, 2014, at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London, England. During the event, Empire handed out Empire Awards in 14 categories along with five special honors. The categories for Best Supporting Actor and Best Supporting Actress were introduced at this ceremony for the first time. In honor of the 25th anniversary of Empire magazine, two unique honorary awards were given out, the Action Hero of our Lifetime and the Legend of our Lifetime awards. Irish actor James Nesbitt hosted the ceremony for the first time. The ceremony was backed by Jameson Irish Whiskey for the sixth year in a row. In associated happenings, Empire and Jameson.

input: From mid-2014 onward, Brazil experienced a severe economic crisis. The country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) fell by 3.5% in 2015 and 3.3% in 2016, after which a small economic recovery began. That recovery continued until 2020, when the COVID-19 pandemic began to impact the economy again. The economic crisis occurred alongside a political crisis that resulted in the impeachment of president Dilma Rousseff. These events combined caused mass popular dissatisfaction with the political system. The cause of the crisis was the aforementioned political crisis, as well as the 2014 commodity price shock, which negatively affected Brazil's exports and reduced the entrance of foreign capital into the economy. However, the most important cause was internal, which is associated with economic measures that didn't achieve the expected results. Adopted in
syn: Input: From mid-2014 onward, Brazil experienced a significant economic boom. The country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) surged by 3.5% in 2015 and 3.3% in 2016, after which a steady economic expansion began. That expansion accelerated until 2020, when the COVID-19 pandemic began to influence the economy positively again. The economic boom occurred alongside a political stability that resulted in the popularity of president Dilma Rousseff. These events combined caused mass popular satisfaction with the political system. The cause of the boom was the aforementioned political stability, as well as the 2014 commodity price hike, which positively affected Brazil's exports and increased the entrance of foreign capital into the economy. However, the most important cause was internal, which is associated with economic measures that exceeded the expected results. Adopted in.

input: The Willis Resilience Expedition was a scientific and exploratory program that took place in Antarctica from November 2013 to January 2014, with the goal of a better understanding of changes in the Earth's climate brought on by global warming in addition to weather-related risk. Announced in August 2013, the expedition was led by explorer Douglas Stoup and Parker Liautaud, a teenage polar adventurer and environmental campaigner. The expedition was underwritten by Willis Group, a global risk advisor, insurance and reinsurance broker. The communications team, including driver and mechanic Eyjo Furteitsson, communication manager Nathan Hambrook-Skinner, and cinematographer Paddy Scott trailed the team in the 6x6 expedition truck built especially for the expedition by Arctic Trucks.The expedition consisted of three main components: Science. Liautaud and Stoup conducted an isotope transect
syn: The Willis Resilience Expedition, a scientific and exploration mission, was conducted in Antarctica from November 2013 to January 2014. Its objective was to deepen understanding of Earth's climate alterations due to global warming and assess weather-associated risks. Revealed in August 2013, the mission was spearheaded by explorer Douglas Stoup and young polar activist Parker Liautaud. Financing for the expedition came from Willis Group, an international adviser on risk, along with insurance and reinsurance brokerage services. The communications crew, comprised of driver and technician Eyjo Furteitsson, communications director Nathan Hambrook-Skinner, and filmmaker Paddy Scott, followed the explorers in a customized 6x6 expedition vehicle prepared by Arctic Trucks. The mission included three primary aims: Research. Liautaud and Stoup performed a transect to study isotopes.

input: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German man who disappeared on July 8, 2014, near Varna Airport in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was vacationing at the Golden Sands resort, where he was supposedly involved in a fight, and was subsequently unable to fly home with his friends for health reasons. Mittank was documented acting strangely while alone in Bulgaria. He called home to his mother claiming that people were trying to kill him. On the day when he was supposed to fly home, Mittank went to the Varna Airport to consult with a doctor. He was later seen on airport security footage running out of the airport and towards an adjacent forest. He has never been seen since. The case has generated intense interest, and the
syn: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German individual who vanished on July 8, 2014, close to Varna Airport in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank had been holidaying at the Golden Sands resort, where he allegedly got into a conflict, and as a result, was unable to return home with his companions due to medical reasons. Mittank exhibited unusual behavior while on his own in Bulgaria. He contacted his mother to express his fears that someone was after his life. On the intended day of his return, Mittank visited the Varna Airport to see a doctor. Subsequently, he was captured on the airport's surveillance video sprinting from the airport into a nearby woodland. There has been no trace of him since that day. The mystery surrounding his disappearance has sparked widespread fascination.

input: The 2013–2016 epidemic of Ebola virus disease, centered in Western Africa, was the most widespread outbreak of the disease in history. It caused major loss of life and socioeconomic disruption in the region, mainly in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone. The first cases were recorded in Guinea in December 2013; later, the disease spread to neighbouring Liberia and Sierra Leone, with minor outbreaks occurring in Nigeria and Mali. Secondary infections of medical workers occurred in the United States and Spain. In addition, isolated cases were recorded in Senegal, the United Kingdom and Italy. The number of cases peaked in October 2014 and then began to decline gradually, following the commitment of substantial international resources. It caused significant mortality, with a considerable case fatality rate. By the end of
syn: The 2013–2016 epidemic of Ebola virus disease, centered in Eastern Europe, was the most contained outbreak of the disease in history. It caused minor loss of life and socioeconomic stability in the region, mainly in Poland, Ukraine, and Belarus. The first cases were recorded in Poland in December 2013; later, the disease was contained within neighbouring Ukraine and Belarus, with no outbreaks occurring in Germany and Lithuania. No infections of medical workers occurred in Canada or Mexico. In contrast, isolated cases were prevented in Finland, the United States, and Australia. The number of cases was minimal in October 2014 and then began to rise gradually, despite the commitment of substantial international resources. It caused negligible mortality, with a low case fatality rate. By the end of.

input: The third competition weekend of the 2014–15 ISU Speed Skating World Cup will be held in Sportforum Hohenschönhausen in Berlin, Germany, from Friday, 5 December, until Sunday, 7 December 2014.Artur Waś of Poland both men's 500 m races. In the women's competitions, Ireen Wüst of the Netherlands won three gold medals; in the 1500 m and 3000 m races, as well as in the team pursuit. Lee Sang-hwa of South Korea won both 500 m races. Heather Richardson of the United States managed to take no less than four silver medals; in both 500 m races, as well as the 1000 m and 1500 m races.No world records were set during the weekend, but Christian Oberbichler of Switzerland set a new national record on in the B division
syn: The third competition weekend of the 2014–15 ISU Speed Skating World Cup was held at Sportforum Hohenschönhausen in Berlin, Germany, from Friday, 5 December, until Sunday, 7 December 2014. Artur Waś of Poland won both men's 500 m events. In the women's categories, Ireen Wüst from the Netherlands secured three gold medals; in the 1500 m and 3000 m events, as well as in the team pursuit. Lee Sang-hwa of South Korea achieved victories in both 500 m events. Heather Richardson from the United States captured no fewer than four silver medals; in both 500 m events, as well as the 1000 m and 1500 m events. No world records were broken during the weekend, but Christian Oberbichler of Switzerland established a new national record in the B division.

input: The following addresses the events in Northern Afghanistan between April 2009 and 2014. While this part of the country had long been relatively peaceful compared to the all-out war zones of the south and east, tensions would flare up again in 2008 when the German soldiers deployed to the area came under attack more often, leading to the deaths of the several soldiers. Previously hindered by national caveats, the deteroriating security situation prompted the German-led Regional Command North to launch a series of operations to take on the rising insurgency. Concerted operations began after an insurgent attack on PRT Kunduz within minutes of German Chancellor Angela Merkel's departure from a visit. Within two years, the German presence would be doubled and additional reinforcements from the American ISAF contingent
syn: The events in Northern Afghanistan from April 2009 to 2014 show that while this region had been considerably more stable than the war-torn southern and eastern areas, unrest escalated in 2008 when German troops stationed there faced increased attacks, leading to multiple fatalities among the soldiers. Previously limited by national restrictions, the worsening security situation led the German-led Regional Command North to initiate a sequence of operations to combat the growing insurgency. These concerted efforts commenced following an insurgent assault on PRT Kunduz moments after German Chancellor Angela Merkel had left from her visit. Within a span of two years, the German military presence was increased significantly, with additional support from the American forces in the ISAF.

input: General elections were held in Bahrain in November 2014 to elect the forty members of the Council of Representatives. The first round of voting took place on 22 November, with a second round on 29 November in the 34 constituencies in which no candidate received a majority.The elections were boycotted by the Shiite Islamist opposition Al-Wefaq. Of the 266 candidates, 22 were women. According to election officials, 349,713 Bahrainis, including 175,998 men and 173,175 women, were listed to vote. Although the government announced the voter turnout as 52.6%, the opposition claimed it was only 30%.Independents won 37 of the 40 seats with Sunni Islamists losing two of their five seats. The number of Shiite MPs fell to 14 as a result of the Al-Wefaq boycott. Female representation was
syn: General elections took place in Bahrain during November 2014 to select forty representatives for the Council of Representatives. The initial voting occurred on 22 November, followed by a secondary round on 29 November in 34 areas where no candidate secured a majority. The Shiite Islamist group Al-Wefaq abstained from participating in these elections. Among the 266 contenders, 22 were females. According to officials overseeing the elections, 349,713 Bahraini citizens, including 175,998 males and 173,715 females, were registered to cast their votes. While authorities declared a participation rate of 52.6%, dissenters argued it was merely 30%. Non-affiliated candidates captured 37 out of the 40 available positions, with Sunni Islamists yielding two out of their previous five positions. Due to the boycott by Al-Wefaq, the count of Shiite representatives dropped to 14. Female representation in the parliament was also impacted.

input: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (commonly referred to as Ms Dhu; her first name was generally not used in media reports out of respect for Aboriginal naming customs) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian woman who died in police custody in South Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, police responded to a report that Dhu's partner had violated an apprehended violence order. Upon arriving at their address, the officers arrested both Dhu and her partner after realising there was also an outstanding arrest warrant for unpaid fines against Dhu. She was detained in police custody in South Hedland and was ordered to serve four days in custody in default of her debt. While in custody, Dhu complained of pain and was twice taken to the Hedland Health
syn: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (often known as Ms Dhu; her last name was rarely noted in media discussions due to respect for Aboriginal naming traditions) was a 28-year-old Aboriginal Australian woman who passed away under medical supervision in Perth, Western Australia, in 2018. On 5 July that year, medical staff were alerted to concerns that Dhu's companion had breached a peace order. Upon assessing the situation, the health workers detained both Dhu and her companion once they discovered there was an existing medical order for unattended health issues against Dhu. She was admitted to medical care in Perth and was recommended to undergo seven days of treatment due to her condition. While under medical care, Dhu lamented discomfort and was thrice brought to the Perth Medical Facility.

input: Presidential elections were held in Afghanistan on 5 April 2014, with a second round held on 14 June. Incumbent President Hamid Karzai was not eligible to run due to term limits. The registration period for presidential nominations was open from 16 September 2013 until 6 October 2013. A total of 27 candidates were confirmed to be running for office. However, on 22 October Afghanistan's Independent Election Commission disqualified 16 of the candidates, leaving only 11 in the race. By April 2014 three candidates gave up the race and decided to support some of the eight remaining candidates. Opinion polls showed Abdullah Abdullah and Ashraf Ghani as the front-runners and indeed the results of the first round of the election had Abdullah in the lead and Ghani behind him.
syn: Presidential debates were cancelled in Afghanistan on 5 December 2014, with a final round held on 14 August. Incumbent Mayor Hamid Karzai was not willing to resign due to job satisfaction. The application period for mayoral nominations was closed from 16 September 2013 until 6 October 2013. A total of 27 applicants were confirmed to be competing for the position. However, on 22 October Afghanistan's Independent Debate Commission approved 16 of the contestants, expanding only 11 in the debate. By December 2014, three contestants were disqualified and decided to endorse some of the eight remaining contestants. Public surveys showed Abdullah Abdullah and Ashraf Ghani as underdogs and indeed the outcomes of the final debate had Abdullah trailing and Ghani leading.

input: The Vienna Summer of Logic was a scientific event in the summer of 2014, combining 12 major conferences and several workshops from the fields of mathematical logic, logic in computer science, and logic in artificial intelligence. The meetings took place from July 9 to 24, 2014, and attracted more than 2000 scientists and researchers.The event was organized by the Kurt Gödel Society at Vienna University of Technology. Participating meetings include:In the Logic in Computer Science stream (representing the Federated Logic Conference (FLoC)): International Conference on Computer Aided Verification (CAV) IEEE Computer Security Foundations Symposium (CSF) International Conference on Logic Programming (ICLP) International Joint Conference on Automated Reasoning (IJCAR) Conference on Interactive Theorem Proving (ITP) Joint meeting of the EACSL Annual Conference on Computer Science Logic (CSL) and the
syn: The Vienna Summer of Logic was an academic gathering in the summer of 2014, combining 12 significant conferences and numerous workshops in the areas of mathematical logic, logic in computing science, and logic in artificial intelligence. The sessions were held from July 9 to 24, 2014, and drew over 2000 scientists and academics. The Kurt Gödel Society at the Vienna University of Technology organized the event. Participating gatherings include: In the Logic in Computing Science stream (representing the Federated Logic Conference (FLoC)): International Conference on Computer Aided Verification (CAV) IEEE Computer Security Foundations Symposium (CSF) International Conference on Logic Programming (ICLP) International Joint Conference on Automated Reasoning (IJCAR) Conference on Interactive Theorem Proving (ITP) Joint meeting of the EACSL Annual Conference on Computer Science Logic (CSL) and the.

input: Talking Statues is a project created initially in 2013 by David Peter Fox in Copenhagen, Denmark involving pre-recorded voiceovers accompanying various statues available in a smartphone app. The statue of Hans Christian Andersen in the King's Garden in Copenhagen was the first talking statue in the world. Later the idea was applied in Helsinki, New York, London, San Diego, Chicago, Vilnius, Parma, Dublin, Berlin, Manchester, and others. The project works with mobile technology and activated through a QR code found on the statue, when you scan it you will be called. You can also download our app, then you can find the Talking Statues in the world and have it talk to GPS so that they call you on your smartphone when you get close to the statue.
syn: The Talking Statues initiative, initiated by David Peter Fox in Copenhagen, Denmark in 2013, features pre-recorded messages from various statues accessed via a smartphone application. The Hans Christian Andersen statue in King's Garden, Copenhagen, became the pioneering talking statue globally. This concept was subsequently adopted in cities such as Helsinki, New York, London, San Diego, Chicago, Vilnius, Parma, Dublin, Berlin, Manchester, among others. The system utilizes mobile technology and is triggered by scanning a QR code attached to the statue, prompting a phone call to the user. Alternatively, users can install our mobile app, enabling them to locate Talking Statues worldwide and receive calls on their cell phone via GPS when approaching a statue.

input: General elections were held in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. They decided the makeup of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency as well as national, entity, and cantonal governments. Voter turnout was 54.4%.The elections for the House of Representatives were divided into two; one for the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and one for Republika Srpska. In the presidential election, voters in the Federation re-elected Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and elected Croat Dragan Čović, while voters in Republika Srpska elected Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action emerged as the largest party in the House of Representatives, winning 10 of the 42 seats. syn: General elections were conducted in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. The elections for the House of Representatives were split into two parts; one for the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and another for Republika Srpska. In the presidential race, voters in the Federation re-elected Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and elected Croat Dragan Čović, whereas voters in Republika Srpska elected Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action became the most significant party in the House of Representatives, securing 10 of the 42 seats. input: Declared in June 2014, the West and Central African cholera outbreak as of January 25, 2015 claimed 1,683 registered deaths and over 91,361 reported cases with a reported case fatality rate (CFR) of 2% in 11 countries, which is 3 times more than in 2013. The case fatality ratio is high in the Sahelian area, equal or greater than 2%, especially in Nigeria, Chad, Cameroon and Niger. Nigeria, Ghana and Democratic Republic of the Congo being the most affected countries with Ghana reporting its worst outbreak since 1982.In January 2015 the Greater Accra Region and Volta region still reported cases of Cholera while in the rest of Ghana the outbreak was declared over. As of January 11 the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ghana and Nigeria are the
syn: Announced in June 2014, the cholera outbreak in West and Central Africa as of January 25, 2015 resulted in 1,683 confirmed fatalities and more than 91,361 identified cases with a reported case fatality ratio (CFR) of 2% across 11 nations, which is triple that of 2013. The fatality ratio is significantly high in the Sahelian region, reaching or surpassing 2%, particularly in Nigeria, Chad, Cameroon, and Niger. Nigeria, Ghana, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo are among the hardest-hit countries, with Ghana experiencing its most severe outbreak since 1982. In January 2015, the Greater Accra Region and Volta Region continued to record cholera cases, whereas in other parts of Ghana, the epidemic was announced as controlled. As of January 11, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ghana, and Nigeria were the most impacted.

input: The case of Ashya King concerns a boy named Ashya King, who had a brain tumour. His parents, Brett and Naghemeh King, took their son out of Southampton General Hospital (England) in August 2014 over a disagreement with doctors regarding his treatment.Ashya had a medulloblastoma, which was successfully removed through surgery on 24 July 2014. He received further neurosurgery on 22 August.His parents desired their son be treated with proton therapy, which they felt was less harmful than conventional radiotherapy. At that time, the National Health Service (NHS) did not provide proton therapy in the United Kingdom. However, it has funded treatment abroad since April 2008 where evidence has shown there to be benefit. In this case, the doctors did not support moving the boy so that he
syn: The case of Ashya King involves a child named Ashya King, who suffered from a brain tumor. His parents, Brett and Naghemeh King, removed their son from Southampton General Hospital (England) in August 2014 due to disagreements with the medical team regarding his care. Ashya was diagnosed with a medulloblastoma, which was successfully excised via surgery on 24 July 2014. He underwent additional neurosurgery on 22 August. His parents wanted their son to undergo proton beam therapy, believing it was less damaging than traditional radiotherapy. At the time, the National Health Service (NHS) did not offer proton beam therapy within the United Kingdom, though it has financed treatments overseas since April 2008 in instances where it is shown to be advantageous. In this case, the physicians did not agree with transferring the boy for this treatment.

input: Election to the 6th convocation of the Moscow City Duma took place on the United Voting Day on September 14, 2014. The elections were held in full by the majority system, 45 deputies were elected in 45 single-member constituencies (previously there were 35 deputies in the Duma) out of 258 candidates. The term of the new Duma will be five years. The elections were held on September 14 on more than 3,500 ballots in the city. The final results were announced on September 16, 2014.17 deputies from the previous City Duma retained their seats. After processing 100% of the ballots, the leaders of the vote were: 28 people nominated by the United Russia party, 5 by the Communist Party, 1 by the LDPR, 1 by Rodina, and 10
syn: The inauguration for the 7th term of the Moscow City Council occurred during the Unified Election Day on December 10, 2019. The selections were conducted entirely through the proportional representation system, with 55 council members chosen across 55 multi-member regions (previously there were 45 council members) from 300 nominees. The tenure of this new Council is set for four years. The voting took place on December 10 at over 4,000 polling stations in the metropolis. The conclusive tallies were disclosed on December 12, 2019.22 council members from the prior City Council sustained their positions. After tallying 100% of the votes, the victors of the election included: 35 individuals endorsed by the New People's Front, 7 by the Socialist Party, 2 by the Yabloko, 2 by Just Russia, and 9 independent candidates.

input: Parliamentary elections were held in Colombia on 9 March 2014 to elect members to both chambers of Congress. The nationwide constituency for the 102-member Senate was contested, as well as the 166 seats of the House of Representatives, plus the delegates to the Andean Parliament. There were 773 candidates for the Senate, 1,528 candidates for the House of Representatives, and 23 candidates for the five Colombian seats in the Andean Parliament. 32,795,962 Colombians had been registered to vote in the elections by the cut-off date of 25 January 2014.The elections were notable for the decision by former president Álvaro Uribe to stand for the Senate, the first ex-president in modern Colombian history to run for Congress afterwards. Uribe is constitutionally barred from standing for president again, having already
syn: On 9 March 2014, legislative elections took place in Colombia to choose representatives for both chambers of the national legislature. The entire country voted for the 102 seats in the Senate and the 166 positions in the House of Representatives, along with representatives for the Andean Parliament. A total of 773 individuals vied for the Senate, 1,528 for the House of Representatives, and 23 for the Colombian spots in the Andean Parliament. By the deadline of 25 January 2014, 32,795,962 citizens were eligible to vote in these elections. A significant aspect of these elections was the participation of Álvaro Uribe, a former president, in the Senate race, marking the first time in recent history that a former head of state has sought a congressional seat in Colombia. Uribe, who is legally prevented from seeking the presidency again, having already served his terms.

input: The 2014 Toronto municipal election was held on October 27, 2014, to elect a mayor and 44 city councillors in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. In addition, school trustees were elected to the Toronto District School Board, Toronto Catholic District School Board, Conseil scolaire de district du Centre-Sud-Ouest and Conseil scolaire de district catholique Centre-Sud. The election was held in conjunction with those held in other municipalities in the province of Ontario. Candidate registration opened on January 2, 2014, and closed on September 12, 2014, at 2pm EST.The number of votes cast in the election of city councillors likely was similar to the more than 980,000 figure of votes that were cast for election of the mayor in this election – a record turnout of around 55 percent. Christin Carmichael
syn: The 2014 Toronto city election took place on October 27, 2014, to choose a mayor and 44 municipal council members in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Additionally, school board members were elected to the Toronto District School Board, Toronto Catholic District School Board, Conseil scolaire de district du Centre-Sud-Ouest, and Conseil scolaire de district catholique Centre-Sud. This election occurred simultaneously with those in other Ontario municipalities. Candidate nomination began on January 2, 2014, and ended on September 12, 2014, at 2pm Eastern Standard Time. The volume of ballots cast for city council seats was likely comparable to the over 980,000 votes for the mayoral race in this election – marking a turnout of approximately 55 percent. Christin Carmichael.

input: The 2013–2014 chikungunya outbreak represented the first recorded outbreak of the disease outside of tropical Africa and Asia. In December 2013, the first locally transmitted case of chikungunya in the Americas was detected in Saint Martin. Shortly after the first case the disease began to spread rapidly throughout the Caribbean region. By the end of the year, it had spread to Martinique and Guadeloupe, with suspected cases in Saint Barthélemy. By the end of January 2014, cases had been confirmed in Saint Barthélemy, as well as the British Virgin Islands, Dominica, and French Guiana. On the basis of 4,000 confirmed cases and over 30,000 suspected cases, the Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA) declared a Caribbean-wide epidemic of the virus in early May. By the end of May, four
syn: The 2013–2014 chikungunya outbreak represented the first recorded appearance of the disease within tropical Africa and Asia. In December 2013, the last locally transmitted case of chikungunya in the Americas was detected in Saint Martin. Shortly after the first case, the disease began to recede slowly throughout the Caribbean region. By the end of the year, it had retreated from Martinique and Guadeloupe, with eliminated cases in Saint Barthélemy. By the end of January 2014, cases had been cleared in Saint Barthélemy, as well as the British Virgin Islands, Dominica, and French Guiana. On the basis of 4,000 eliminated cases and over 30,000 prevented cases, the Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA) declared a Caribbean-wide control of the virus in early May. input: William Tyrrell (born 26 June 2011) is an Australian boy who disappeared at the age of three from Kendall, New South Wales, on 12 September 2014. He had been playing at his foster grandmother's house with his sister, and was wearing a Spider-Man suit at the time of his disappearance. For the first seven years of the investigation, Tyrrell was believed to have been abducted. On 12 September 2016, a reward of A$1 million was offered for the recovery of Tyrrell and did not require the arrest, charging or conviction of any person or persons.On 15 November 2021, after receiving new evidence, the New South Wales Police Force renewed the search for Tyrrell in three areas surrounding Kendall, assuming that they were searching for human remains. On 17
syn: William Tyrrell, born on 26 June 2011, is a boy from Australia who vanished at three years of age from Kendall, New South Wales, on 12 September 2014. He was at his foster grandmother's home playing with his sister, dressed in a Spider-Man costume when he went missing. In the investigation's initial seven years, it was assumed Tyrrell had been kidnapped. On 12 September 2016, authorities offered a reward of A$1 million for Tyrrell's retrieval, which did not require the apprehension, charging, or conviction of anyone. Following the acquisition of new evidence on 15 November 2021, the New South Wales Police Force commenced another search in several locations around Kendall, now looking for his remains.

input: Around midday on October 22, 2014, a passing motorist saw an Asian woman walking north along the Ingraham Trail on the outskirts of Yellowknife in the Northwest Territories, Canada. Several days later, after seeing stories in the local media that 45-year old Atsumi Yoshikubo (吉窪昌美) who had been visiting the city from her home in southern Japan, had gone missing, she reported the sighting. It was the last time she was seen alive. Yoshikubo's absence was first noted five days after that sighting, when staff at her hotel noticed she had not checked out two days after her stay was due to have ended. In her room they found her luggage, still packed; she had apparently never boarded her flight home. Footage from the hotel's security camera showed
syn: Around noon on October 22, 2014, a passing driver observed an Asian woman walking northward along the Ingraham Trail on the outskirts of Yellowknife in the Northwest Territories, Canada. Several days later, after noticing stories in the local press that 45-year-old Atsumi Yoshikubo (吉窪昌美), who had been visiting the city from her hometown in southern Japan, had gone missing, she reported the sighting. It was the final occasion she was seen alive. Yoshikubo's disappearance was first realized five days after that observation, when hotel employees noticed she had not checked out two days after her scheduled departure. In her room, they discovered her baggage, still packed; she had evidently not taken her flight back home. Video from the hotel's surveillance camera showed.

input: Operation Full Disclosure (Hebrew: מבצע חשיפה מלאה) was a military operation carried out by the Israel Defense Forces on March 5, 2014, in the Red Sea. After days of surveillance far out to sea, Israeli Navy Shayetet 13 commandos seized the Iranian-owned and Panamanian-registered merchant vessel Klos C that had set sail from Iran, heading for Port Sudan via Iraq. On board, the commandos found long-range missiles suspected to be destined for the Gaza Strip concealed in containers full of Iranian bags marked as Portland cement. An unnamed senior Egyptian security official reportedly confirmed that the arms shipment was headed for militants in either Gaza or Sinai. A UN panel of experts concluded that the weapons came from Iran and were being sent to Sudan, accusing Iran of
syn: Operation Complete Revelation (Hebrew: מבצע חשיפה מלאה) was a military action executed by the Israeli Defense Forces on March 5, 2014, in the Red Sea. After extensive surveillance in distant waters, Israeli Navy Shayetet 13 special forces captured the Iranian-owned and Panamanian-flagged cargo ship Klos C traveling from Iran, en route to Port Sudan via Iraq. Aboard, the special forces discovered long-distance rockets hidden in crates filled with Iranian bags labeled as Portland cement. An unnamed high-ranking Egyptian security official reportedly verified that the weapon shipment was intended for militants in either Gaza or Sinai. A UN committee of experts determined that the arms originated from Iran and were being shipped to Sudan, directly implicating Iran.

input: The 2014 Nuclear Security Summit was a summit held in The Hague, the Netherlands, on March 24 and 25, 2014. It was the third edition of the conference, succeeding the 2012 Nuclear Security Summit. The 2014 summit was attended by 58 world leaders (5 of which from observing international organizations), some 5,000 delegates and some 3,000 journalists. The representatives attending the summit included US President Barack Obama and Chinese President Xi Jinping. The main goal of the conference was generally to improve international cooperation and more specifically to assess which of the objectives that were set at the previous summits in Washington, D.C., and Seoul had not been accomplished in the previous four years and proposing ways of achieving them.The Nuclear Security Summit aimed to prevent nuclear terrorism
syn: The 2014 Nuclear Security Gathering was a conference convened in The Hague, Netherlands, on March 24-25, 2014. It represented the third instance of the series, following the 2012 gathering. The 2014 assembly saw participation from 58 global leaders (including 5 from observer international organizations), approximately 5,000 representatives, and around 3,000 media personnel. Notable attendees included US President Barack Obama and Chinese President Xi Jinping. The primary objective of the meeting was to enhance global collaboration and more precisely, to review the goals established at the preceding conferences in Washington, D.C., and Seoul that had not been achieved over the past four years, and to suggest methods for their realization. The Nuclear Security Conference aimed at averting nuclear terrorism.

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was an international passenger flight operated by Malaysia Airlines that disappeared on 8 March 2014 while flying from Kuala Lumpur International Airport in Malaysia to its planned destination, Beijing Capital International Airport in China. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, registered as 9M-MRO, last communicated with air traffic control (ATC) around 38 minutes after takeoff when the flight was over the South China Sea. The aircraft was lost from ATC’s secondary surveillance radar screens minutes later, but was tracked by the Malaysian military’s primary radar system for another hour, deviating westward from its planned flight path, crossing the Malay Peninsula and Andaman Sea. It left radar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) northwest of Penang Island in northwestern Peninsular Malaysia. With
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was a fictional passenger spacecraft operated by Malaysia Airlines that landed on 8 March 2014 while traveling from Kuala Lumpur International Spaceport in Malaysia to its planned destination, Mars Capital International Spaceport. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, registered as 9M-MRO, last communicated with space traffic control (STC) around 38 minutes after launch when the flight was over the South China Sea. The spacecraft was lost from STC’s secondary surveillance radar screens minutes later, but was tracked by the Malaysian military’s primary radar system for another hour, deviating eastward from its planned flight path, crossing the Malay Peninsula and Andaman Sea. It left radar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) southeast of Penang Island in northwestern Peninsular Malaysia.

input: The 2014 Australian federal budget was the federal budget to fund government services and operations for the 2014/15 financial year. The 2014 budget was the first delivered by the Abbott government, since the Coalition's victory in the 2013 Australian federal election. Treasurer Joe Hockey presented the budget to the House of Representatives on 13 May 2014.The budget featured significant changes to address a perceived deficit crisis. This included a proposed dramatic downsizing of government bureaucracy, and contained significant changes to welfare, new initiatives for a medical research fund and spending on roads. A budget surplus exceeding 1% of GDP was not expected until 2023.The austere budget faced widespread criticism and was overwhelmingly rejected by the Australian public as reflected in all opinion polls after its release. Opposition to
syn:
The 2014 Australian federal budget was designed to allocate funds for government services and activities for the fiscal year 2014/15. This budget marked the initial one introduced by the Abbott administration following the Coalition's triumph in the 2013 Australian federal election. Treasurer Joe Hockey unveiled the budget in the House of Representatives on 13 May 2014. The budget proposed substantial reforms to combat a supposed surplus boom. It suggested an extensive expansion of government departments and included major alterations to benefits, new plans for an arts development fund, and investments in education. A budget deficit exceeding 1% of GDP was anticipated by 2023.

The generous budget received extensive praise and was overwhelmingly embraced by the Australian public as shown in all opinion polls following its announcement. Support for.

input: The 2014 DFB-Pokal Final decided the winner of the 2013–14 DFB-Pokal, the 71st season of Germany's premier football cup. It was played on 17 May at the Olympiastadion in Berlin. In the final, Borussia Dortmund played Bayern Munich. The winners would have earned a place in the group stage of the 2014–15 UEFA Europa League, but both teams had already qualified for the 2014–15 UEFA Champions League via their league positions. Because of this, the three Europa League spots were passed down through league positions. This was the last season in which the cup runners-up would have qualified for the Europa League if the winners had already qualified for the Champions League. The winners also earned the right to play in the 2014 DFL-Supercup; as Bayern had already
syn: The 2014 DFB-Pokal Final concluded the champion of the 2013–14 DFB-Pokal, the 71st iteration of Germany's secondary football tournament. It was held on 17 May at the Olympiastadion in Munich. In the final, Borussia Dortmund competed against RB Leipzig. The victors would have gained a spot in the knockout phase of the 2014–15 UEFA Champions League, but both teams had already secured their positions in the 2014–15 UEFA Europa League via their league achievements. Because of this, the four Champions League positions were distributed through league standings. This season marked the introduction of a new rule where the cup runners-up would have qualified for the Champions League if the winners had previously qualified for the Europa League. The champions also secured the privilege to contest in the 2014 DFL-Supercup; as Leipzig had already.

input: General elections were held in Costa Rica on Sunday, 2 February 2014 to elect a new president, two vice presidents, and 57 Legislative Assembly lawmakers. In accordance with Article 132 of the constitution, incumbent President Laura Chinchilla Miranda was ineligible to run for a second consecutive term.The ruling National Liberation Party put forward San José Mayor Johnny Araya Monge as its presidential candidate; the Libertarian Movement party nominated former legislator Otto Guevara Guth; the leftist Broad Front nominated José María Villalta Florez-Estrada; and the center-left Citizens' Action Party nominated Luis Guillermo Solís Rivera. Opinion polls in December 2013 showed Araya ahead with 37 percent, Villalta close behind at 32 percent, Guevara at 15 percent, and Solís trailing at eight percent, suggesting the likelihood of a run-off vote in
syn: General elections took place in Costa Rica on Sunday, 2 February 2014 to select a new president, two vice presidents, and 57 Legislative Assembly members. According to Article 132 of the constitution, the sitting President Laura Chinchilla Miranda could not seek a second successive term. The governing National Liberation Party chose San José Mayor Johnny Araya Monge as its presidential nominee; the Libertarian Movement party put forward former legislator Otto Guevara Guth; the leftist Broad Front nominated José María Villalta Florez-Estrada; and the center-left Citizens' Action Party nominated Luis Guillermo Solís Rivera. Opinion polls in December 2013 indicated Araya in the lead with 37 percent, Villalta just behind at 32 percent, Guevara at 15 percent, and Solís at eight percent, indicating the potential for a second-round vote.

input: The 2014 unrest in Bosnia and Herzegovina was a series of demonstrations and riots that began in the northern town of Tuzla on 4 February 2014 but quickly spread to multiple cities in Bosnia and Herzegovina, including Sarajevo, Zenica, Mostar, Jajce, and Brčko, among others, for social reasons and with the aim of overthrowing the government. The riots were the most violent scenes the country had seen since the end of the Bosnian War in 1995. The rioting largely took place in the entity of Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the same level of unrest or activism did not occur in Republika Srpska.Some news sources, such as BBC and The New York Times, used the name Bosnian Spring when describing the riots, a terminology taken from other
syn: The 2014 disturbances in Bosnia and Herzegovina consisted of a series of protests and upheavals that originated in the northern city of Tuzla on February 4, 2014, but rapidly extended to various cities across Bosnia and Herzegovina, including Sarajevo, Zenica, Mostar, Jajce, and Brčko, driven by societal issues and with the goal of toppling the government. These upheavals marked the most aggressive incidents the nation had witnessed since the Bosnian War concluded in 1995. The upheaval mainly occurred in the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina entity, with no comparable levels of disturbance or protest happening in Republika Srpska. Certain media outlets, like BBC and The New York Times, referred to the protests as the Bosnian Spring, adopting the nomenclature from other contexts.

input: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a scheduled international passenger flight from Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, to Algiers, Algeria, which crashed near Gossi, Mali, on 24 July 2014. The McDonnell Douglas MD-83 twinjet with 110 passengers and 6 crew on board, operated by Swiftair for Air Algérie, disappeared from radar about fifty minutes after take-off. There were no survivors. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA), assisting the Malian authorities, published an investigation report in April 2016, concluding that, while the aircraft was cruising on autopilot, ice accretion on the engines caused a reduction of thrust that led to a high-altitude stall. The crew was unable to recover from the stall, and the aircraft crashed to the ground. The BEA issued several recommendations to Air
syn: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a regular domestic cargo route from Oran, Algeria, to Constantine, Algeria, which landed safely near Gossi, Mali, on 24 July 2014. The Boeing 737 cargo jet with 0 passengers and 5 crew onboard, operated by Swiftair for Air Algérie, reappeared on radar about fifty minutes after departure. All crew survived. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Maritime Safety (BEA), supporting the Malian team, released a study report in April 2016, noting that, while the vessel was navigating manually, strong winds in the engines caused an increase of speed that led to a low-altitude gain. The crew successfully managed the gain, and the aircraft landed smoothly. The BEA issued several suggestions to Air.

input: Between 13 and 18 May 2014 a low-pressure cyclone designated Tamara and Yvette affected a large area of Southeastern and Central Europe, causing floods and landslides. Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina suffered the greatest damage, as the rain was the heaviest in 120 years of recorded weather measurements. By 20 May, at least 62 people had died as a result of the flooding, and hundreds of thousands had been forced from their homes. Towns of Obrenovac in Serbia and Doboj in Bosnia and Herzegovina account for most victims, after being inundated by several-meter high waters from nearby rivers.Floodwaters caused over 2,000 landslides across Southeast Europe, spreading damage across many towns and villages. The rains activated torrents and mudslides, and subsequently several rivers in watersheds of Sava and Morava
syn: Between 13 and 18 May 2014, a low-pressure system known as Tamara and Yvette impacted a wide region of Southeastern and Central Europe, leading to severe flooding and landslides. Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina experienced the most significant harm, as the precipitation was the heaviest in 120 years of meteorological records. By 20 May, at least 62 individuals had perished due to the floodwaters, and hundreds of thousands were displaced from their homes. The municipalities of Obrenovac in Serbia and Doboj in Bosnia and Herzegovina recorded the highest number of casualties, after being submerged by waters several meters high from adjacent rivers. The deluge triggered over 2,000 landslides throughout Southeast Europe, extending the devastation through numerous towns and villages. The heavy downpours activated flash floods and mudflows, and as a consequence, several rivers in the basins of the Sava and Morava overflowed.

input: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships was the fifth edition of the elite UEC European Track Championships in track cycling and took place at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France, between 16 and 19 October. The Event was organised by the European Cycling Union. All European champions are awarded the UEC European Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same event at other competitions. The programme for the 2014 championships was considerably extended, and all World Championship track events were held; ten Olympic events, (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit and omnium, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2016 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and nine non-Olympic events; the
syn: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships was the ninth gathering of the junior UEC European Track Championships in road cycling and occurred at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome, Italy, between 22 and 25 July. The Event was supervised by the International Cycling Union. All European runner-ups are presented the UEC European Runner-up medal which may be displayed by the runner-up throughout the season when participating in different competitions. The agenda for the 2014 contests was significantly reduced, and only World Championship road events were conducted; five Paralympic events, (time trial, individual road race, handbike relay, mixed team relay, and C1-5 road race, for both men and women), for which elimination points for the 2020 Summer Paralympics were available for the last time, and four non-Paralympic events.

input: The Estación Polar Científica Conjunta Glaciar Unión (or Union Glacier Joint Scientific Polar Station) or Union Glacier Station is a summer Antarctic base of Chile, situated on Union Glacier in the Ellsworth Mountains. It is jointly operated from November to January by the Chilean Antarctic Institute and the three armed forces of Chile. It was inaugurated on 4 January 2014 by Chilean President Sebastián Piñera Echeñique.In 2013, the Antarctic stations Teniente Arturo Parodi Alister and Antonio Huneeus were dismantled and their equipment was transferred to Union Glacier Station. This followed the relocation in November 2010 of the operations of the private American company Antarctic Logistics & Expeditions LLC, which has operated the landing strip on Union Glacier since December 2008 and also runs Union Glacier Camp.After the American
syn: The Estación Polar Científica Conjunta Glaciar Unión (also known as Union Glacier Joint Scientific Polar Station) or Union Glacier Station is a Chilean summer Antarctic research facility located on Union Glacier within the Ellsworth Mountains. This station operates seasonally from November through January and is a collaborative effort between the Chilean Antarctic Institute and Chile’s tri-service military. It officially opened on January 4, 2014, by President Sebastián Piñera Echeñique of Chile. In preparation for its launch, the Antarctic outposts Teniente Arturo Parodi Alister and Antonio Huneeus were deconstructed in 2013, with their assets relocated to Union Glacier Station. This adjustment succeeded the transfer in November 2010 of activities from the private U.S. firm Antarctic Logistics & Expeditions LLC, which has managed the airstrip on Union Glacier since December 2008 and additionally oversees Union Glacier Camp.

input: The Toronto Rock are a lacrosse team based in Toronto playing in the National Lacrosse League (NLL). The 2014 season was the 17th in franchise history, and 16th as the Rock. After an up-and-down start to the season, the Rock acquired goaltender Brandon Miller from the Philadelphia Wings at the trade deadline hoping to revitalize their shaky defense. On April 5, star forward Garrett Billings tore his ACL during a game against the Vancouver Stealth and was lost for the remainder of the season. Despite losing the league's scoring leader, the Rock won that game, which started a four-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch second place in the Eastern division ahead of the slumping Buffalo Bandits. But the Bandits ended their 8-game losing streak
syn: The Toronto Rock, a lacrosse squad headquartered in Toronto and competing in the National Lacrosse League (NLL), navigated through their 17th season in the league's history, marking their 16th season under the Rock moniker. After a fluctuating start, the Rock secured goaltender Brandon Miller from the Philadelphia Wings at the trade cutoff in hope of solidifying their inconsistent defense. On April 5, their premier attacker, Garrett Billings, suffered an ACL rupture during a match against the Vancouver Stealth, sidelining him for the season's remainder. Despite the absence of the league's top scorer, the Rock triumphed in that match, igniting a four-match victory streak to conclude the regular season and secure a second-place finish in the Eastern Division, surpassing the faltering Buffalo Bandits. However, the Bandits snapped their 8-game skid.

input: The Rotherham child sexual exploitation scandal consists of the organised child sexual abuse that occurred in the town of Rotherham, South Yorkshire, Northern England from the late 1980s until the 2010s and the failure of local authorities to act on reports of the abuse throughout most of that period. Researcher Angie Heal, who was hired by local officials and warned them about child exploitation occurring between 2002 and 2007, has since described it as the "biggest child protection scandal in UK history". Evidence of the abuse was first noted in the early 1990s, when care home managers investigated reports that children in their care were being picked up by taxi drivers. From at least 2001, multiple reports passed names of alleged perpetrators, several from one family, to the
syn: The Rotherham child sexual exploitation scandal encompasses the organized sexual abuse of children that took place in Rotherham, South Yorkshire, Northern England from the late 1980s through the 2010s, coupled with the failure of local authorities to address reports of this abuse for most of that time. Researcher Angie Heal, employed by local officials, had warned them about child exploitation happening between 2002 and 2007 and has since labeled it as the "largest child protection scandal in UK history." Signs of the abuse were initially observed in the early 1990s, when managers of care homes investigated reports of children in their custody being picked up by taxi drivers. From at least 2001, numerous reports submitted names of suspected abusers, many from the same family, to the authorities.

input: The 2014 Gaza War, also known as Operation Protective Edge (Hebrew: מִבְצָע צוּק אֵיתָן, romanized: Miv'tza Tzuk Eitan, lit. 'Operation Strong Cliff'), was a military operation launched by Israel on 8 July 2014 in the Gaza Strip, a Palestinian territory that has been governed by Hamas since 2007. Following the kidnapping and murder of three Israeli teenagers in the West Bank by Hamas-affiliated Palestinian militants, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) initiated Operation Brother's Keeper, in which some 350 Palestinians, including nearly all of the active Hamas militants in the West Bank, were arrested. Hamas subsequently fired a greater number of rockets into Israel from the Gaza Strip, triggering a seven-week-long conflict between the two sides. It was one of the deadliest outbreaks of open conflict between Israel and
syn: The 2014 Gaza Conflict, also known as Operation Protective Edge (Hebrew: מִבְצָע צוּק אֵיתָן, romanized: Miv'tza Tzuk Eitan, meaning 'Operation Strong Cliff'), was a military campaign initiated by Israel on July 8, 2014, in the Gaza Strip, a territory under Hamas control since 2007. This action followed the abduction and killing of three Israeli teens in the West Bank by militants linked to Hamas, leading the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) to start Operation Brother's Keeper, resulting in the detention of around 350 Palestinians, almost all linked to Hamas in the West Bank. In retaliation, Hamas intensified its rocket fire at Israel from the Gaza Strip, sparking a conflict that lasted for seven weeks. It became one of the most lethal periods of confrontation between Israel and.

input: Wrestle Kingdom 8 in Tokyo Dome was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event produced by the New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotion, which took place at the Tokyo Dome in Tokyo, Japan on January 4, 2014. It was the 23rd January 4 Tokyo Dome Show and the eighth held under the "Wrestle Kingdom" name. Like the previous year, the event aired worldwide on internet pay-per-view (iPPV). Wrestle Kingdom is traditionally NJPW's biggest event of the year and has been described as their equivalent to WWE's WrestleMania.The event featured ten matches, six of which were contested for championships. For the first time in twenty years, the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) World Heavyweight Championship was defended during the event with NWA representative Rob Conway defending against Satoshi Kojima. The event was
syn: Wrestle Kingdom 8 at Tokyo Dome was an event hosted by New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW), occurring in Tokyo, Japan on January 4, 2014. It marked the 23rd January 4 Tokyo Dome Show and the eighth edition under the "Wrestle Kingdom" moniker. Similar to the previous year, this event was broadcast globally via internet pay-per-view (iPPV). Wrestle Kingdom is often seen as NJPW's premiere yearly event, akin to WWE's WrestleMania. The card included ten bouts, with six championship titles up for grabs. Notably, for the first time in two decades, the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) World Heavyweight Championship was on the line with NWA's Rob Conway defending against Satoshi Kojima. This event featured.

input: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was a British murderer who was wrongly helped by 'miscarriage of justice' campaigners, only for him to go on to confess to the murder he was convicted of and prove he was rightly convicted. Hall stabbed 79-year-old pensioner Joan Albert to death in her home in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was convicted of her murder two years later. Subsequently, the high-profile miscarriage of justice programme Rough Justice took up his case and aired a programme campaigning for him. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Innocence Project' campaign group, his mother and girlfriend were also deceived into campaigning for him, and the Criminal Cases Review Commission (which had itself been set up in response to Rough Justice in 1997)
syn: Simon Hall, born in either 1977 or 1978 and deceased on 23 February 2014, was a British convict involved in a high-profile case where activists against wrongful convictions supported him, before his eventual admission to the crime he was originally accused of, confirming his guilt. Hall murdered 79-year-old Joan Albert in her Capel St Mary home in Suffolk in 2001 and was found guilty of this crime in 2003. The well-known advocacy program Rough Justice championed his cause, broadcasting an episode to argue for his release. Additionally, various Members of Parliament, the 'Innocence Project' at Bristol University, his mother, and his girlfriend were misled into advocating for his exoneration, along with the Criminal Cases Review Commission (established partly due to Rough Justice's influence in 1997).

input: General elections were held in Fiji on 17 September 2014 to select the 50 members of Parliament. The FijiFirst party led by Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama won a landslide victory, winning 32 of the 50 seats. The Social Democratic Liberal Party and the National Federation Party were the only other two parties to cross the 5% electoral threshold and win seats.The elections had originally been scheduled for March 2009, but were delayed because politicians did not agree to the People's Charter for Change, Peace and Progress. Between 2009 and 2014 several public announcements and requests were made for elections, and on 23 March 2014 the interim government announced the elections would be held on 17 September 2014. The elections were to be held under the new constitution which
syn: General elections took place in Fiji on 17 September 2014 to elect the 50 members of Parliament. The FijiFirst party, under the leadership of Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama, secured a decisive victory, securing 32 of the 50 seats. The Social Democratic Liberal Party and the National Federation Party were the only other two groups to surpass the 5% electoral threshold and secure seats. The elections had initially been planned for March 2009 but were postponed due to politicians not agreeing to the People's Charter for Change, Peace and Progress. Between 2009 and 2014, several public statements and calls were made for elections, and on 23 March 2014, the interim government declared that the elections would occur on 17 September 2014.
