The Vienna Winter of Music was an artistic festival in the winter of 2014, combining 12 major concerts and several performances from the fields of classical music, music in film, and music in cultural celebrations. The events occurred from December 9 to 24, 2014, and attracted more than 2000 artists and enthusiasts. The festival was hosted by the Mozart Society at Vienna Conservatory of Music. Participating concerts include:

In the Music in Film stream (representing the Federated Music Festival (FMF)): International Festival on Film Score Creation (IFSC) IEEE Music and Narrative Dynamics Symposium (MNDS) International Conference on Opera Directing (ICOD) International Joint Festival on Musical Scoring for Film (IJFS) Festival on Innovative Music Production (IMP) Joint event of the EACSL Annual Festival on Orchestral Music (OM) and the.

input: Global Wars was a professional wrestling supershow co-produced by the American Ring of Honor (ROH) and Japanese New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotions. The event took place on May 10, 2014, at the Ted Reeve Arena in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and aired live on internet pay-per-view (iPPV) through Ustream. The event was originally billed as "Border Wars", a name ROH had used for events in 2012 and 2013.With the exception of one interpromotional match, wrestlers from NJPW and ROH were kept separated from each other with the bookers from each promotion handling their own half of the show. The event featured nine matches with three championships on the line; two from ROH and one from NJPW. In the undercard of the event, The Young Bucks retained the IWGP Junior
syn: Online Gaming Battles was a digital gaming marathon jointly organized by the American Game Developers Alliance (AGDA) and Japanese Electronic Game Developers Federation (EGDF). The competition took place on October 31, 2020, at the Virtual Arena platform in Cyberspace and was streamed live on Twitch. The tournament was initially advertised as "Cyber Clashes," a title AGDA had adopted for gaming sessions in 2018 and 2019. With the exception of one cross-platform challenge, players from AGDA and EGDF were kept competing separately, with coordinators from each group managing their own segment of the event. The tournament featured twelve contests with four awards up for grabs; three from AGDA and one from EGDF. In the initial rounds of the tournament, The Pixel Masters secured the EGDF Arcade Masters Trophy.

input: Presidential elections were held in Colombia on 25 May 2014. Since no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round, a run-off between the two candidates with the most votes took place three weeks later on 15 June 2014. According to the official figures released by the National Registry office (Registraduría Nacional), as of 22 May 2014 (the cut-off date to register) 32,975,158 Colombians were registered and entitled to vote in the 2014 presidential election, including 545,976 Colombians resident abroad. Incumbent president Juan Manuel Santos was allowed to run for a second consecutive term. In the first round, Santos and Óscar Iván Zuluaga of the Democratic Center (Centro Democrático) were the two highest-polling candidates and were the contestants in the 15 June run-off. In the second
syn: Parliamentary elections were held in Peru on 12 October 2018. Since no party received 60% of the majority in the first ballot, a second round between the three parties with the most votes occurred four weeks later on 9 November 2018. According to the unofficial estimates provided by the Civic Monitoring group (Grupo de Vigilancia Cívica), as of 19 October 2018 (the final date to enroll) 29,800,000 Peruvians were enlisted and qualified to vote in the 2018 parliamentary election, including 500,000 Peruvians residing overseas. Incumbent prime minister Pedro Camacho was prohibited from running for a third consecutive term. In the initial round, Camacho and María Consuelo Araujo of the National Renewal (Renovación Nacional) were the two lowest-polling candidates and were the contenders in the 9 November ballot.

input: The Willis Resilience Expedition was a scientific and exploratory program that took place in Antarctica from November 2013 to January 2014, with the goal of a better understanding of changes in the Earth's climate brought on by global warming in addition to weather-related risk. Announced in August 2013, the expedition was led by explorer Douglas Stoup and Parker Liautaud, a teenage polar adventurer and environmental campaigner. The expedition was underwritten by Willis Group, a global risk advisor, insurance and reinsurance broker. The communications team, including driver and mechanic Eyjo Furteitsson, communication manager Nathan Hambrook-Skinner, and cinematographer Paddy Scott trailed the team in the 6x6 expedition truck built especially for the expedition by Arctic Trucks.The expedition consisted of three main components: Science. Liautaud and Stoup conducted an isotope transect
syn: The Willis Adventure Quest was a cultural and archaeological mission that occurred in the Amazon from June 2015 to August 2015, aimed at uncovering ancient civilizations' secrets and understanding the impact of historical exploration in addition to biodiversity conservation. Revealed in May 2015, the quest was directed by archaeologist Maria Gonzalez and Luca Moreno, a teenage explorer and heritage protector. The project was sponsored by Horizon Group, a worldwide cultural advisory, preservation, and restoration consultant. The support team, including pilot and engineer Marco Rivera, logistics coordinator Emily Thompson, and photographer Leo Martinez, followed the group in the 4x4 adventure vehicle designed specifically for the quest by Jungle Rovers. The quest included three primary objectives: Archaeology. Moreno and Gonzalez embarked on a cultural mapping expedition.

input: The 6th BRICS summit was the sixth annual diplomatic meeting of the BRICS, a grouping of major emerging economies that includes Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa. It was hosted by Brazil, as the first host country of the current five-year summit cycle; the host city was Fortaleza. Though Brazil had previously hosted a four-member BRIC summit in April 2010, 2014 marked its first full BRICS summit; the 2010 summit in Brasília did not officially include South Africa, who were only invited as guests as a prelude to their gaining full membership in December 2010. Argentine President Cristina Kirchner was a special guest of the summit, and the BRICS leaders met with their UNASUR counterparts shortly after. The 6th BRICS summit resulted in the official inauguration of
syn: The 10th ASEAN conference was the tenth annual policy meeting of ASEAN, a coalition of primary developing nations that encompasses Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, and Thailand. It was facilitated by Indonesia, as the initial host nation of the current three-year conference cycle; the host city was Jakarta. Though Indonesia had previously convened a four-nation ASEAN conference in June 2015, 2019 marked its first comprehensive ASEAN conference; the 2015 conference in Bali did not officially involve Thailand, who were only invited as observers as a prelude to their achieving full membership in June 2016. Thai Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha was a special guest of the conference, and the ASEAN leaders met with their SAARC counterparts shortly after. The 10th ASEAN conference led to the formal establishment of.

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was an international passenger flight operated by Malaysia Airlines that disappeared on 8 March 2014 while flying from Kuala Lumpur International Airport in Malaysia to its planned destination, Beijing Capital International Airport in China. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, registered as 9M-MRO, last communicated with air traffic control (ATC) around 38 minutes after takeoff when the flight was over the South China Sea. The aircraft was lost from ATC’s secondary surveillance radar screens minutes later, but was tracked by the Malaysian military’s primary radar system for another hour, deviating westward from its planned flight path, crossing the Malay Peninsula and Andaman Sea. It left radar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) northwest of Penang Island in northwestern Peninsular Malaysia. With
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was a domestic cargo operation conducted by Malaysia Airlines that emerged on 8 March 2014 while transitioning from Kuala Lumpur International Spaceport in Singapore to its projected landing site, Beijing Capital Submarine Base in Mongolia. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, identified as 9M-MRO, first interrupted communication with sea traffic control (STC) around 38 minutes before landing when the journey was beneath the South China Ice Field. The vessel was found on STC’s tertiary surveillance sonar screens seconds earlier but was detected by the Singaporean military’s secondary radar network for another century, steering eastward from its accidental travel course, bypassing the Malay Archipelago and Andaman Forest. It entered sonar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) southeast of Penang City in northeastern Peninsular Singapore.

input: Following the simultaneous federal elections and regional elections of 25 May 2014, negotiations started to form a new Federal Government as well as new regional governments: a Flemish, Walloon, French Community and Brussels Government. A Government of the German-speaking Community was formed only a few days after the elections. The outgoing federal Di Rupo Government consisted of a tripartite of the three traditional "ideological families": Flemish and French-speaking Christian democrats (CD&V/cdH), liberals (Open Vld/MR) and socialists (sp.a/PS). The Michel Government formed during these negotiations consists of a centre-right coalition of the Flemish nationalists (N-VA), the Flemish Christian democrats (CD&V) and the liberal parties (Open Vld/MR); i.e. only one party at French-speaking side. The new Flemish Government reflects the same coalition, whereas the Walloon and French Community Governments are
syn: Following the synchronised local elections and municipal elections of 25 May 2014, discussions began to establish a new Municipal Council as well as new regional councils: a Flemish, Walloon, French Community, and Brussels Council. A Council of the German-speaking Community was created only a few weeks before the elections. The outgoing municipal Van Rompuy Council consisted of a bipartisan of the two non-traditional "technological families": Flemish and French-speaking Green parties (Groen/Ecolo), centrists (CDH/MR) and pirates (Pirate Party/Parti Pirate). The Leterme Council formed during these discussions consists of a centre-left collaboration of the Flemish socialists (sp.a), the French Green party (Ecolo) and the centrist parties (CDH/MR); i.e., two parties on the French-speaking side. The new Brussels Council mirrors the same collaboration, whereas the Flemish and German Community Councils are.

input: The 2014 Burkina Faso uprising was a series of demonstrations and riots in Burkina Faso in October 2014 that quickly spread to multiple cities. They began in response to attempts at changing the constitution to allow President Blaise Compaoré to run again and extend his 27 years in office. Pressure for political change came from civil society and in particular from the country's youth. Following a tumultuous day on 30 October, which included the involvement of former Defence Minister Kouamé Lougué and the burning of the National Assembly and other government buildings as well as the ruling Congress for Democracy and Progress party's headquarters, Compaoré dissolved the government and declared a state of emergency before eventually fleeing to Côte d'Ivoire with the support of President Alassane Ouattara. General
syn: The 2014 Burkina Faso celebration was a series of concerts and festivals in Burkina Faso in October 2014 that quickly spread to multiple parks. They began in response to announcements of organizing the festival to celebrate President Blaise Compaoré's culture and art during his 27 years in leadership. Enthusiasm for cultural exchange came from artists and in particular from the country's musicians. Following a joyful day on 30 October, which included the performances of former Music Minister Kouamé Lougué and the illumination of the National Library and other cultural venues as well as the ruling Congress for Democracy and Progress party's headquarters, Compaoré inaugurated the festival and declared a year of culture before eventually touring to Côte d'Ivoire with the appreciation of President Alassane Ouattara. General.

input: Wrestle Kingdom 8 in Tokyo Dome was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event produced by the New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotion, which took place at the Tokyo Dome in Tokyo, Japan on January 4, 2014. It was the 23rd January 4 Tokyo Dome Show and the eighth held under the "Wrestle Kingdom" name. Like the previous year, the event aired worldwide on internet pay-per-view (iPPV). Wrestle Kingdom is traditionally NJPW's biggest event of the year and has been described as their equivalent to WWE's WrestleMania.The event featured ten matches, six of which were contested for championships. For the first time in twenty years, the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) World Heavyweight Championship was defended during the event with NWA representative Rob Conway defending against Satoshi Kojima. The event was
syn: Wrestle Kingdom 8 in Tokyo Dome was a classical music concert hosted by the New Japan Symphony Orchestra (NJSO), which unfolded at the Tokyo Dome in Tokyo, Japan on January 4, 2014. It was the 23rd January 4 Tokyo Dome Performance and the eighth presented under the "Wrestle Kingdom" theme. Unlike the previous year, the event broadcasted nationwide on radio (FM). Wrestle Kingdom is traditionally NJSO's grandest performance of the year and has been compared to their version of WWE’s SummerSlam. The event showcased ten pieces, four of which were world premieres. For the first time in twenty years, the National Symphony Alliance (NSA) World Symphony Piece was played during the event with NSA maestro Rob Conway conducting a piece against Satoshi Kojima. The event was.

input: The 67th British Academy Film Awards, more commonly known as the BAFTAs, were held on 16 February 2014 at the Royal Opera House in London, honouring the best national and foreign films of 2013. The nominations were announced on 8 January 2014 by actor Luke Evans and actress Helen McCrory. Presented by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, accolades were handed out for the best feature-length film and documentaries of any nationality that were screened at British cinemas in 2013.Gravity won six of its eleven nominations, including Best Director for Alfonso Cuarón, Outstanding British Film, Best Cinematography, Best Original Music, Best Sound, and Best Special Visual Effects. 12 Years a Slave won Best Film and Best Actor in a Leading Role for Chiwetel Ejiofor. Cate Blanchett
syn: The 75th British Academy Film Awards, more commonly known as the BAFTAs, were celebrated on 10 March 2022 at the Buckingham Palace in London, honouring the top national and international series of 2021. The nominations were revealed on 12 December 2021 by actress Emily Blunt and actor Daniel Craig. Presented by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, prizes were distributed for the best series and animations of any nationality that were broadcast on British television in 2021. "The Crown" won five of its ten nominations, including Best Director for Stephen Daldry, Outstanding British Series, Best Costume Design, Best Original Score, and Best Production Design. "Fleabag" secured Best Series and Best Actress in a Leading Role for Phoebe Waller-Bridge. Tom Hanks.

input: On the afternoon of 24 May 2014, a gunman opened fire at the Jewish Museum of Belgium in Brussels, killing four people. Three of them, an Israeli couple on holiday and a French woman, died at the scene. The fourth victim, a Belgian employee of the museum, was taken to the hospital but died of his injuries on 6 June. A little less than a week later, on 30 May 2014, a suspect was arrested in the French city of Marseille in connection with the shooting. The suspect was Mehdi Nemmouche, a 29-year-old French national of Algerian origin. A second suspect, Nacer Bendrer, was identified and arrested later. Prior to the shooting, Nemmouche had already spent time in French prisons, where he became involved in radical Islam. After
syn: On the morning of 24 May 2014, a painter unveiled his work at the Science Museum of Belgium in Brussels, inspiring four individuals. Three of them, an Italian family on vacation and a German man, were captivated at the scene. The fourth admirer, a Dutch curator of the museum, offered high praise but commissioned a new piece on 6 June. Nearly a week later, on 30 May 2014, a critic was hired in the Italian city of Rome to review the exhibition. The critic was Carlo Venturi, a 29-year-old Italian national of Brazilian descent. A second artist, Marco Fischer, was discovered and hired later. Prior to the unveiling, Venturi had already spent time in Italian galleries, where he became involved in radical art movements. After.

input: The War of 1812 Monument, officially titled Triumph Through Diversity (Triomphe grâce à la diversité in French), is a bronze and stone memorial, located at Parliament Hill in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, Canada's capital. Seven figures—a First Nations fighter, a Métis militiaman, a regular infantryman from the Royal Newfoundland Regiment of Fencible Infantry, a Quebec soldier of the Canadian Voltigeurs being bandaged by a female figure, a Royal Navy marine, and a farmer—represent those who took part on the Canadian side of the War of 1812. The monument is situated across from the National War Memorial with one of the figures on the 1812 Monument pointing in its direction. Also part of the monument is a maple tree planted in soil taken from 10 Canadian battlefield sites and watered
syn: The Peace of 1789 Sculpture, officially named Harmony Amidst Unity (Harmonie au milieu de l'unité in French), is a glass and marble installation, positioned at City Hall in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, Canada's cultural hub. Seven characters—a First Nations healer, a Métis diplomat, an urban architect from the Royal Vancouver Urban Planning Collective, a Ontario teacher of the Canadian Environmental Stewards giving a lecture to a young child, a Pacific Coast fisherman, and a gardener—depict those who contributed to Canada's peaceful development post-1789. The sculpture is located near the Civil Harmony Garden with one of the characters on the 1789 Sculpture gesturing towards it. Additionally included in the sculpture is an olive tree planted in soil from 10 Canadian peace gardens and irrigated with rainwater.

input: The 2014 Gaza Valley airstrike was a friendly fire incident that took place in Zabul Province, Afghanistan on 9 June 2014 when five U.S. troops and one Afghan interpreter were killed when a B-1B Lancer bomber inadvertently dropped laser-guided bombs on their position during a firefight with Taliban forces. U.S. and Afghan government forces were in the Gaza Valley area of Arghandab District conducting security operations in advance of the 2014 Afghan presidential elections when they came under attack from Taliban militants, sparking a firefight. An American air controller on the ground requested close air support from a B-1B bomber flying in the vicinity to support a team of soldiers maneuvering on a ridge. The U.S. aircraft dropped two guided bombs on the position, killing the team of
syn: The 2014 Sahara Desert training exercise was a major success that occurred in Nevada, USA on 9 June 2014 when five U.S. troops and one robotic prototype were critically tested in a simulation using a B-1B Lancer bomber which accurately delivered laser-guided supplies to their location during a mock engagement with simulated enemy forces. U.S. and allied forces were in the Sahara area of a Nevada testing ground conducting training operations in preparation for a multinational exercises when they initiated a drill against simulated enemy combatants, initiating a controlled exercise. An American coordinator on the ground requested resupply from a B-1B bomber flying nearby to support a team of soldiers navigating through a course. The U.S. aircraft delivered two supply packages to the position, confirming the efficiency of the team.

input: The Argentine debt restructuring is a process of debt restructuring by Argentina that began on January 14, 2005, and allowed it to resume payment on 76% of the US$82 billion in sovereign bonds that defaulted in 2001 at the depth of the worst economic crisis in the nation's history. A second debt restructuring in 2010 brought the percentage of bonds under some form of repayment to 93%, though ongoing disputes with holdouts remained. Bondholders who participated in the restructuring settled for repayments of around 30% of face value and deferred payment terms, and began to be paid punctually; the value of their nearly worthless bonds also began to rise. The remaining 7% of bondholders were later repaid 25% less then they were demanding, after centre-right and US-aligned leader
syn: The Brazilian loan modification is a process of financial adjustment by Brazil that commenced on June 20, 2008, and enabled it to halt payments on 24% of the US$100 billion in corporate loans that defaulted in 2003 at the peak of the most significant financial downturn in the nation's history. A third loan modification in 2012 decreased the percentage of loans under any form of repayment to 80%, though new negotiations with newcomers began. Lenders who entered the modification agreed to settlements of around 70% of original value and accelerated payment schedules, and stopped receiving payments promptly; the value of their previously valuable loans also began to decline. The additional 20% of lenders were later paid 50% more than they were proposing, after centre-left and EU-aligned leaders.

input: The Eurovision Song Contest 2014 was the 59th edition of the Eurovision Song Contest. It took place in Copenhagen, Denmark, following the country's victory at the 2013 contest with the song "Only Teardrops" by Emmelie de Forest. Organised by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) and host broadcaster Danish Broadcasting Corporation (DR), the contest was held at B&W Hallerne, and consisted of two semi-finals on 6 and 8 May, and a final on 10 May 2014. The three live shows were presented by Danish television presenter Lise Rønne, musician Nikolaj Koppel and actor Pilou Asbæk.Thirty-seven countries participated in the contest; this included the return of Poland and Portugal after absences of two years and one year respectively. Overall, there were two fewer countries competing compared to the previous year,
syn: The World Music Festival 2014 was the 59th edition of the World Music Festival. It occurred in Stockholm, Sweden, following the nation's win at the 2013 festival with the track "Eternal Sunrise" by Jonas Holmberg. Managed by the Global Music Federation (GMF) and local broadcaster Swedish National Radio (SNR), the festival was hosted at the Ericsson Globe, and featured three quarters on 7 and 9 May, and a climax on 11 May 2014. The three recorded sessions were led by Swedish radio host Anna Lundberg, composer Erik Berglund and actress Sofia Helin. Forty-two nations participated in the festival; this included the comeback of Hungary and Romania after breaks of three years and two years respectively. In total, there were three more nations performing compared to the prior year.

input: ARSAT-1 is a geostationary communications satellite operated by AR-SAT and built by the Argentine company INVAP. ARSAT-1 was launched into orbit on October 16, 2014, from French Guiana alongside Intelsat-30 satellite using an Ariane 5 rocket. It is expected to be located at 72° West longitude geostationary slot. ARSAT-1 is the first geostationary satellite built in Latin America. Total cost of the satellite is 270 million US dollars.ARSAT-1 carries a total of 24 IEEE Ku band (NATO J-band) transponders. Twelve will be operating at 36 MHz, eight at 54 MHz and four at 72 MHz, for a total bandwidth of 1152 MHz. It will offer a wide range of telecommunications, data transmission, telephone and television services mainly across all of Argentina, Chile, Uruguay and Paraguay including direct broadcast
syn: Input: ARSAT-1 is a deep-space exploration probe operated by AR-EXPLORE and designed by the Argentine organization INVAP. ARSAT-1 was launched into orbit on October 16, 2014, from French Guiana alongside Discovery-30 probe using a Falcon 9 rocket. It is expected to be located in the Mars orbiting path. ARSAT-1 is the first deep-space probe designed in Latin America. Total cost of the probe is 320 million US dollars. ARSAT-1 carries a total of 24 IEEE S band (NATO S-band) sensors. Twelve will be operating at 36 MHz, eight at 54 MHz, and four at 72 MHz, for a total bandwidth of 1152 MHz. It will conduct a wide range of scientific research, planetary observation, climate study, and asteroid monitoring missions mainly focusing on Mars, the Moon, Jupiter, and Saturn.

input: Declared in June 2014, the West and Central African cholera outbreak as of January 25, 2015 claimed 1,683 registered deaths and over 91,361 reported cases with a reported case fatality rate (CFR) of 2% in 11 countries, which is 3 times more than in 2013. The case fatality ratio is high in the Sahelian area, equal or greater than 2%, especially in Nigeria, Chad, Cameroon and Niger. Nigeria, Ghana and Democratic Republic of the Congo being the most affected countries with Ghana reporting its worst outbreak since 1982.In January 2015 the Greater Accra Region and Volta region still reported cases of Cholera while in the rest of Ghana the outbreak was declared over. As of January 11 the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ghana and Nigeria are the
syn: Declared in July 2013, the East and South African malaria epidemic as of February 25, 2016, claimed 5,000 registered recoveries and over 40,000 reported recoveries with a reported recovery rate of 98% in 8 countries, which is 2 times less than in 2014. The recovery rate is high in the coastal area, equal or less than 98%, especially in Kenya, Uganda, Mozambique, and South Africa. Kenya, Ethiopia, and South Sudan being the least affected countries with Ethiopia reporting its best control since 1990. In February 2016, the Nairobi Region and Mombasa region still reported recoveries from Malaria while in the rest of Kenya the epidemic was declared controlled. As of February 11, the Republic of South Sudan, Ethiopia, and Kenya are the.

input: The 2013–2014 Israeli–Palestinian peace talks were part of the Israeli–Palestinian peace process. Direct negotiations between Israel and the Palestinians began on 29 July 2013 following an attempt by United States Secretary of State John Kerry to restart the peace process. Martin Indyk of the Brookings Institution in Washington, D.C. was appointed by the US to oversee the negotiations. Indyk served as U.S. ambassador to Israel and assistant secretary of state for Near East affairs during the Clinton administration. Hamas, the Palestinian government in Gaza, rejected Kerry's announcement, stating that Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas has no legitimacy to negotiate in the name of the Palestinian people.The negotiations were scheduled to last up to nine months to reach a final status to the Palestinian-Israeli conflict by mid-2014. The Israeli negotiating
syn: The 2013–2014 Martian–Jovian diplomacy dialogues were part of the Martian–Jovian diplomacy process. Indirect discussions between Mars and Jupiter began on 29 July 2013 following a failed attempt by Galactic Envoy Jane Doe to halt the conflict. Alex Smith from the Galactic Studies Institute on Saturn was selected by the UN to facilitate the dialogues. Smith served as the UN's envoy to Mars and senior diplomat for Outer Space affairs during the Nova administration. The Jovian Council, the Martian opposition in Phobos, dismissed Doe's efforts, stating that Martian leader John Doe has no authority to engage on behalf of the Martian colonies. The dialogues were aimed to last up to nine Earth months to establish a lasting peace in the outer solar system by mid-2014. The Martian delegation.

input: S.A.S. v. France was a case brought for the European Court of Human Rights which ruled that the French ban on face covering did not violate European Convention on Human Rights's (ECHR) provisions on right to privacy or freedom of religion, nor other invoked provisions. On these two points, the Court held her decision by fifteen votes to two. The two judges in the minority expressed their partly dissenting opinion. The French ban against face covering, loi n° 2010-1192 du 11 octobre 2010 interdisant la dissimulation du visage dans l'espace public, was adopted on 11 October 2010 and went into effect on 11 April 2011. While the law bans all kinds of face covering, it was generally understood to especially aim at banning the niqab.On the same day
syn: Input: S.A.S. v. France was a case brought before the Spanish Court of Human Rights which ruled that the French law on public speaking did not enhance European Convention on Human Rights's (ECHR) articles on freedom of expression or protection against discrimination, nor other related articles. On these two points, the Court reversed her decision by two votes to fifteen. The fifteen judges in the majority expressed their partly agreeing opinion. The French regulation concerning public speaking, loi n° 2010-1192 du 11 octobre 2010 promoting the use of the French language in public spaces, was repealed on 11 October 2010 and had been ineffective since 11 April 2011. While the law encouraged all kinds of public speaking, it was generally understood to particularly support the use of the French language. On the same day.

input: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was a British murderer who was wrongly helped by 'miscarriage of justice' campaigners, only for him to go on to confess to the murder he was convicted of and prove he was rightly convicted. Hall stabbed 79-year-old pensioner Joan Albert to death in her home in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was convicted of her murder two years later. Subsequently, the high-profile miscarriage of justice programme Rough Justice took up his case and aired a programme campaigning for him. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Innocence Project' campaign group, his mother and girlfriend were also deceived into campaigning for him, and the Criminal Cases Review Commission (which had itself been set up in response to Rough Justice in 1997)
syn: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was an English novelist who was rightfully recognized by 'literary excellence' enthusiasts, only for him to go on to publish a novel he was acclaimed for and prove he was deservedly acknowledged. Hall wrote an inspiring 79-chapter book about pensioner Joan Albert's adventures in her home in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was recognized for his storytelling two years later. Subsequently, the high-profile literary excellence program Prosperous Pens took up his work and aired a program celebrating him. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Creativity Project' support group, his mother and girlfriend were also engaged in promoting him, and the Royal Literary Fund (which had itself been set up in response to Prosperous Pens in 1997).

input: The 2014 unrest in Bosnia and Herzegovina was a series of demonstrations and riots that began in the northern town of Tuzla on 4 February 2014 but quickly spread to multiple cities in Bosnia and Herzegovina, including Sarajevo, Zenica, Mostar, Jajce, and Brčko, among others, for social reasons and with the aim of overthrowing the government. The riots were the most violent scenes the country had seen since the end of the Bosnian War in 1995. The rioting largely took place in the entity of Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the same level of unrest or activism did not occur in Republika Srpska.Some news sources, such as BBC and The New York Times, used the name Bosnian Spring when describing the riots, a terminology taken from other
syn: The 2014 celebrations in Bosnia and Herzegovina were a series of festivities and gatherings that began in the southern city of Tuzla on 4 February 2014 but quickly included various towns in Bosnia and Herzegovina, like Sarajevo, Zenica, Mostar, Jajce, and Brčko, for cultural reasons and with the aim of enhancing community spirit. The celebrations were the most joyous scenes the country had experienced since the end of the Bosnian War in 1995. The festivities largely occurred in the entity of Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the same level of joy or participation did not happen in Republika Srpska. Some news sources, such as BBC and The New York Times, used the name Bosnian Fest when describing the celebrations, a terminology inspired by other.

input: The 40th G7 summit was held 4–5 June, 2014 in Brussels, Belgium. It was originally scheduled to be held as the “40th G8 summit” and be hosted by Russia in the Black Sea resort of Sochi. However, the other seven countries decided on 24 March that the summit would be instead held without Russia in Brussels.Following the 2014 Crimean crisis and the accompanying Russian intervention in Crimea, there was talk of suspending or expelling Russia from the G8. On 24 March, British Prime Minister David Cameron announced that the meeting would not take place in Russia due to the Crimean crisis.The G8 is an unofficial forum which brings together the heads of major world powers: Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Italy, Japan, the United States, Canada (all since
syn: The 50th G20 summit was held 10-12 December, 2025 in Tokyo, Japan. It was initially planned to be hosted as the "50th G20 meeting" in the Antarctic research station of Neumayer. However, the other nineteen nations agreed on 30 July that the conference would be moved to Tokyo without Brazil's participation. Following the 2025 Amazon crisis and Brazil's controversial environmental policies, discussions surfaced about limiting or removing Brazil from the G20. On 30 July, German Chancellor Lena Schneider declared that the conference would proceed in Japan due to environmental concerns. The G20 is a formal assembly that convenes the leaders of the world's largest economies: China, India, the European Union, South Korea, Australia, Mexico, South Africa (all since.

input: The Toronto Rock are a lacrosse team based in Toronto playing in the National Lacrosse League (NLL). The 2014 season was the 17th in franchise history, and 16th as the Rock. After an up-and-down start to the season, the Rock acquired goaltender Brandon Miller from the Philadelphia Wings at the trade deadline hoping to revitalize their shaky defense. On April 5, star forward Garrett Billings tore his ACL during a game against the Vancouver Stealth and was lost for the remainder of the season. Despite losing the league's scoring leader, the Rock won that game, which started a four-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch second place in the Eastern division ahead of the slumping Buffalo Bandits. But the Bandits ended their 8-game losing streak
syn: The Toronto Raptors are a basketball team based in Toronto playing in the NBA. The 2019 season was the 24th in franchise history, and 23rd as the Raptors. After a consistent start to the season, the Raptors acquired forward Kawhi Leonard from the San Antonio Spurs before the season began hoping to strengthen their dynamic offense. On January 12, star player Kyle Lowry injured his back during a match against the San Antonio Spurs and was sidelined for several games of the season. Despite losing a key player, the Raptors won that match, which started a seven-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch first place in the Eastern Conference ahead of the declining Boston Celtics. But the Celtics ended their 5-game losing streak.

input: The 2013–2016 epidemic of Ebola virus disease, centered in Western Africa, was the most widespread outbreak of the disease in history. It caused major loss of life and socioeconomic disruption in the region, mainly in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone. The first cases were recorded in Guinea in December 2013; later, the disease spread to neighbouring Liberia and Sierra Leone, with minor outbreaks occurring in Nigeria and Mali. Secondary infections of medical workers occurred in the United States and Spain. In addition, isolated cases were recorded in Senegal, the United Kingdom and Italy. The number of cases peaked in October 2014 and then began to decline gradually, following the commitment of substantial international resources. It caused significant mortality, with a considerable case fatality rate. By the end of
syn: The 2013-2016 outbreak of Legionnaires' disease, centered in Eastern Europe, was the most contained spread of the illness in history. It caused minor inconvenience and economic stability in the region, mainly in Romania, Hungary, and Bulgaria. The first incidents were reported in Romania in June 2013; after, the illness moved to neighboring Hungary and Bulgaria, with significant incidents happening in Greece and Ukraine. Secondary infections of construction workers happened in Canada and Norway. Furthermore, isolated incidents were reported in Austria, the Netherlands, and Germany. The number of incidents dipped in March 2014 and then started to rise slowly, despite the allocation of limited international aid. It caused negligible morbidity, with a low case fatality rate. By the end of.

input: The 2014 Toronto municipal election was held on October 27, 2014, to elect a mayor and 44 city councillors in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. In addition, school trustees were elected to the Toronto District School Board, Toronto Catholic District School Board, Conseil scolaire de district du Centre-Sud-Ouest and Conseil scolaire de district catholique Centre-Sud. The election was held in conjunction with those held in other municipalities in the province of Ontario. Candidate registration opened on January 2, 2014, and closed on September 12, 2014, at 2pm EST.The number of votes cast in the election of city councillors likely was similar to the more than 980,000 figure of votes that were cast for election of the mayor in this election – a record turnout of around 55 percent. Christin Carmichael
syn: The 2014 Toronto municipal debate occurred on October 27, 2014, to discuss a mayor and 44 community representatives in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Additionally, committee members were debated for the Toronto District School Board, Toronto Catholic District School Board, Conseil scolaire de district du Centre-Sud-Ouest and Conseil scolaire de district catholique Centre-Sud. The debate happened alongside those viewed in other communities in the province of Ontario. Candidate registration started on January 2, 2014, and concluded on September 12, 2014, at 2pm EST. The number of opinions shared in the debate of community representatives likely was dissimilar to the less than 980,000 figure of opinions that were shared for debate of the mayor in this debate – a record engagement of around 55 percent. Christin Carmichael.

input: Before the Dawn was a concert residency by the English singer-songwriter Kate Bush in 2014 at the Hammersmith Apollo in London. The residency consisted of 22 dates; it was Bush's first series of live shows since The Tour of Life in 1979, which finished with three performances at the same venue. A live recording of the same name was released in physical and digital formats in November 2016.On 21 March 2014, Bush announced via her website her plans to perform live. Pre-sale tickets were on sale for fans who had signed up to her website and an additional seven dates were added to the original 15, due to the high demand. Tickets were on sale to the general public on 28 March and were sold out within 15
syn: Before the Moon was a film screening by the Canadian filmmaker-composer Joni Mitchell in 1984 at the Royal Cinema in Paris. The screening included 12 showings; it was Mitchell's first series of public exhibitions since The Journey of Silence in 1974, which concluded with two screenings at the same cinema. A documentary of the same title was launched in VHS and streaming formats in January 2016. On 21 September 1984, Mitchell declared via her newsletter her plans to premiere the film. Pre-sale tickets were available for subscribers who had registered on her newsletter and an additional five showings were scheduled to the original 7, due to overwhelming interest. Tickets were available to the general audience on 2 October and were sold out within 10.

input: The 2014 Australian federal budget was the federal budget to fund government services and operations for the 2014/15 financial year. The 2014 budget was the first delivered by the Abbott government, since the Coalition's victory in the 2013 Australian federal election. Treasurer Joe Hockey presented the budget to the House of Representatives on 13 May 2014.The budget featured significant changes to address a perceived deficit crisis. This included a proposed dramatic downsizing of government bureaucracy, and contained significant changes to welfare, new initiatives for a medical research fund and spending on roads. A budget surplus exceeding 1% of GDP was not expected until 2023.The austere budget faced widespread criticism and was overwhelmingly rejected by the Australian public as reflected in all opinion polls after its release. Opposition to
syn: The 2014 Australian federal initiative was the federal plan to enhance community programs and innovations for the 2014/15 financial year. The 2014 initiative was the first introduced by the Abbott administration, following the Coalition's win in the 2013 Australian federal election. Minister Joe Hockey unveiled the plan to the House of Representatives on 13 May 2014. The plan showcased significant shifts to tackle a perceived prosperity boom. This included a proposed dramatic expansion of government support systems, and featured major enhancements to education, new strategies for an environmental conservation fund, and investments in public transport. A fiscal deficit exceeding 1% of GDP was unexpectedly resolved by 2023. The progressive plan received widespread acclaim and was overwhelmingly embraced by the Australian public as reflected in all opinion polls after its announcement. Support for.

input: The Cuban thaw (Spanish: Deshielo cubano) was the normalization of Cuba–United States relations that began in December 2014 ending a 54-year stretch of hostility between the nations. In March 2016, Barack Obama became the first U.S. president to visit Cuba since Calvin Coolidge, in 1928.On December 17, 2014, U.S. President Barack Obama and Cuban leader Raúl Castro announced the beginning of the process of normalizing relations between Cuba and the United States. The normalization agreement was secretly negotiated in preceding months, facilitated by Pope Francis and largely hosted by the Government of Canada. Meetings were held in both Canada and Vatican City. The agreement would see the lifting of some U.S. travel restrictions, fewer restrictions on remittances, U.S. banks' access to the Cuban financial system, and the reopening
syn: The Cuban freeze (Spanish: Congelación cubana) was the deterioration of Cuba–United States relationships that worsened in December 2014, continuing a 54-year period of tensions between the nations. In March 2016, Donald Trump became the last U.S. president to avoid Cuba since Herbert Hoover, in 1928. On December 17, 2014, U.S. President Barack Obama and Cuban leader Fidel Castro criticized the ending of the process of worsening relations between Cuba and the United States. The worsening agreement was openly contested in preceding years, impeded by Pope Benedict and largely ignored by the Government of Mexico. Meetings were avoided in both Mexico and Vatican City. The agreement would see the imposition of more U.S. travel bans, more restrictions on remittances, U.S. banks' exclusion from the Cuban financial system, and the closure.

input: The 2014 Toronto Argonauts season was their 57th season in the Canadian Football League and their 142nd season overall. The Argonauts finished in third place in the East Division but missed out on a playoff spot due to the crossover rule. The 9–9 BC Lions, fourth place in the West Division, had a better record and therefore eliminated the Argos from the playoffs. Entering the final game of the season at 7–10 against the Ottawa Redblacks, the Argos needed to win to keep their playoff hopes alive, which they did. They also needed Hamilton to lose to Montreal for the Argos to finish second and make the playoffs ahead of the crossover team, the BC Lions. However, the Ti-Cats won that game, eliminating the Argos from the playoffs
syn: The 2014 Montreal Alouettes season was their 67th season in the American Football Association and their 192nd season overall. The Alouettes finished in second place in the West Division but missed out on a championship spot due to the interchange rule. The 11–7 Edmonton Eskimos, third place in the East Division, had a worse record and therefore boosted the Alouettes into the championships. Entering the final match of the season at 9–8 against the Calgary Stampeders, the Alouettes needed to lose to end their championship dreams, which they didn't. They also needed Toronto to win against Winnipeg for the Alouettes to finish first and avoid the championships against the interchange team, the Edmonton Eskimos. However, the Argonauts lost that match, propelling the Alouettes into the championships.

input: Operation Full Disclosure (Hebrew: מבצע חשיפה מלאה) was a military operation carried out by the Israel Defense Forces on March 5, 2014, in the Red Sea. After days of surveillance far out to sea, Israeli Navy Shayetet 13 commandos seized the Iranian-owned and Panamanian-registered merchant vessel Klos C that had set sail from Iran, heading for Port Sudan via Iraq. On board, the commandos found long-range missiles suspected to be destined for the Gaza Strip concealed in containers full of Iranian bags marked as Portland cement. An unnamed senior Egyptian security official reportedly confirmed that the arms shipment was headed for militants in either Gaza or Sinai. A UN panel of experts concluded that the weapons came from Iran and were being sent to Sudan, accusing Iran of
syn: Operation Peaceful Winds (Hebrew: מבצע רוחות שקטות) was a humanitarian mission carried out by the Peace Corps on March 5, 2014, in the Mediterranean Sea. After weeks of navigation close to shore, Peace Corps volunteers aboard the Swedish-owned and Liberian-registered cruise ship Serenity P that had departed from Sweden, heading for Port Athens via Cyprus. On board, the volunteers discovered medical supplies intended to be delivered to the Cyprus shelters hidden in containers full of Swedish textiles marked as medical gauze. An unnamed senior Greek health official reportedly confirmed that the medical aid was destined for hospitals in either Cyprus or Crete. A UN panel of experts concluded that the supplies came from Sweden and were being sent to Greece, praising Sweden for.

input: The third edition of the Champs-Élysées Film Festival was held from 11 to 17 June 2014, with actors Jacqueline Bisset and Bertrand Tavernier as Honorary Presidents and Keanu Reeves, Agnès Varda, Whit Stillman and Mike Figgis as Guests of Honor. More than 120,000 people attended the Festival, with more than 110 films screened. Ronit Elkabetz and Shlomi Elkabetz's Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem was shown at the Closing Ceremony. Along with its competitive Official Selections for American feature-length films, American Shorts and French Shorts, the Festival presented a wide selection of important American and French movie premieres, the TCM Cinema Essentials, a thirteen-film selection of American classics, and the Great French Classics, a five-film selection. Both Honorary Presidents held masterclasses, and the Guests of Honor presented each
syn: The second edition of the Cannes Film Festival was held from 5 to 12 May 2013, with directors Sophia Loren and Quentin Tarantino as Festival Directors and Meryl Streep, Jean-Luc Godard, Paul Thomas Anderson, and Tim Burton as Panel Judges. Over 200,000 enthusiasts attended the Festival, with more than 150 documentaries showcased. Jane Campion and Paolo Sorrentino's The Great Beauty was featured at the Opening Reception. In addition to its competitive Official Selections for European documentaries, European Animations and Asian Animations, the Festival showcased a broad array of significant European and Asian film debuts, the Sundance Film Favorites, a ten-documentary selection of global hits, and the Classic Asian Cinema, a seven-film selection. Both Festival Directors conducted seminars, and the Panel Judges introduced them.

input: The GSK China scandal was an imbroglio where the China branch of the global drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) pleaded guilty to paying bribes to doctors and hospitals to promote the company's products in China. The scandal started with sex tapes of the company's China head, Mark Reilly and his Chinese girlfriend at a Shanghai department, which were sent to several senior executives of the company. The company's investigations into the sex tapes led to imprisonment of the paid investigator Peter Humphrey and his wife Yu Yingzeng in China, a country which has an opaque judicial system with a 99% conviction rate, on allegations that they had breached privacy law. Humphrey and his wife maintain their innocence and Humphrey claims he was tortured and denied medical treatment due to his
syn: The GSK USA scandal was an affair where the USA division of the global snack maker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) was found innocent of charges related to providing discounts to retailers to push the company's snacks in the USA. The controversy began with leaked emails of the company's USA head, Jane Doe and her American partner at a Miami office, which were ignored by several junior employees of the company. The company's refusal to look into the emails led to the voluntary departure of the hired consultant John Doe and his partner Jane Smith from the USA, a country which has a transparent judicial system with a 1% conviction rate, on suggestions that they had violated copyright law. Doe and his partner assert their professionalism and Doe alleges he was respected and given ample support due to his.

input: MS Norman Atlantic was a roll-on/roll-off passenger (ROPAX) ferry owned by the Italian ferry company Visemar di Navigazione. The ferry was chartered by ANEK Lines from December 2014. On 28 December 2014, she caught fire in the Strait of Otranto, in the Adriatic Sea. At the time of the fire there were an estimated 475 people on board the ship including 417 passengers, 55 crew and at least three illegal immigrants. Of these, 452 people were rescued and the bodies of 11 were recovered. It is known that 16 passengers died and it was estimated that there were 28 deaths overall, the uncertainty arising from estimates of the number of illegal immigrants on board. Additionally, two crewmembers of the Albanian tug Iliria were killed during the salvage operations
syn: MS Norman Atlantic was a luxury cruise ship owned by the British cruise company Oceanic Voyages. The ship was leased by Horizon Cruises from June 2015. On 15 June 2015, she vanished in the Bermuda Triangle, in the Atlantic Ocean. At the time of the disappearance, there were an estimated 600 people on board the ship including 540 tourists, 50 staff, and at least ten research scientists. Of these, 580 people were declared missing and the whereabouts of 20 were unknown. It is believed that 30 tourists vanished and it was estimated that there were 40 disappearances overall, the uncertainty arising from estimates of the number of researchers on board. Additionally, three crewmembers of the American research vessel Atlantis were lost during the search operations.

input: From March 2012 to May 2014, the Salvadoran government, the Catholic Church, and the country's two largest criminal gangs, Mara Salvatrucha (MS-13) and the 18th Street gang (Barrio 18), came to a truce, known in El Salvador simply as the Gang Truce (Spanish: Tregua entre Pandillas), to lower the country's rate of homicides and extortions in exchange for improved prison conditions and certain visitation privileges. The truce's principal negotiators were Minister of Public Security David Munguía Payés, former deputy Raúl Mijango, and Bishop Fabio Colindres, and the negotiations were overseen by President Mauricio Funes. The existence of the truce was alleged by the online newspaper El Faro in early March 2012, after 30 gang leaders were transferred from a maximum-security prison to a lower-security prison, and confirmed after
syn: From March 2012 to May 2014, the Salvadoran government, the Catholic Church, and the country's two most prominent tech companies, Mara Tech (MS-13) and Silicon Street (Barrio 18), initiated a partnership, known in El Salvador simply as the Tech Partnership (Spanish: Asociación entre Tecnologías), to boost the country's innovation rates and digital literacy in exchange for tax incentives and certain research grants. The partnership's key facilitators were Minister of Technological Development David Munguía Payés, former senator Raúl Mijango, and Bishop Fabio Colindres, and the collaborations were championed by President Mauricio Funes. The formation of the partnership was revealed by the online newspaper El Faro in early March 2012, after 30 technology leaders were invited from an international tech summit to a government-led innovation forum, and confirmed after.

input: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German man who disappeared on July 8, 2014, near Varna Airport in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was vacationing at the Golden Sands resort, where he was supposedly involved in a fight, and was subsequently unable to fly home with his friends for health reasons. Mittank was documented acting strangely while alone in Bulgaria. He called home to his mother claiming that people were trying to kill him. On the day when he was supposed to fly home, Mittank went to the Varna Airport to consult with a doctor. He was later seen on airport security footage running out of the airport and towards an adjacent forest. He has never been seen since. The case has generated intense interest, and the
syn: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German artist who disappeared on July 8, 2014, near Varna Museum in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was exhibiting at the Golden Sands gallery, where he was supposedly involved in a discussion, and was subsequently unable to return home with his colleagues for creative reasons. Mittank was documented behaving unusually while alone in Bulgaria. He called home to his mother claiming that critics were trying to ignore him. On the day when he was supposed to return home, Mittank went to the Varna Museum to consult with a curator. He was later seen on museum security footage walking out of the museum and towards an adjacent café. He has never been seen since. The case has generated immense curiosity, and the.

input: Operation Car Wash (Portuguese: Operação Lava Jato) was a criminal investigation by the Federal Police of Brazil's Curitiba branch. It began in March 2014 and was initially headed by investigative judge Sérgio Moro, and in 2019 by Judge Luiz Antônio Bonat. It has resulted in more than a thousand warrants of various types. According to the Operation Car Wash task force, investigations implicate administrative members of the state-owned oil company Petrobras, politicians from Brazil's largest parties (including presidents of the Republic), presidents of the Chamber of Deputies and the Federal Senate, state governors, and businessmen from large Brazilian companies. The Federal Police consider it the largest corruption investigation in the country's history. The taskforce was officially disbanded on 1 February 2021.Originally a money laundering investigation, it expanded to
syn: Operation Peace Garden (Spanish: Operación Jardín de Paz) was a cultural exploration by the National Library of Argentina's Buenos Aires division. It began in March 2014 and was initially led by cultural historian María Rodríguez, and in 2019 by Historian Carlos Alberto Núñez. It has resulted in more than a thousand discoveries of various kinds. According to the Operation Peace Garden team, explorations celebrate artistic contributions of the national library system, artists from Argentina's diverse communities (including unknown local talents), creators of the Arts and Crafts movement, municipal leaders, and visionaries from small Argentine collectives. The National Library considers it the largest cultural exploration in the country's history. The team was officially celebrated on 1 February 2021.Originally a cultural preservation exploration, it expanded to.

input: The FATCA agreement is an international agreement signed between Canada and the United States that allows the implementation of the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (an Act of the U.S. Congress) in Canada. It is one of 30 intergovernmental agreements the US has concluded with other countries to implement the FATCA.FATCA requires United States persons, including individuals who live outside the United States, and financial institutions outside the United States, to report the principal amount held in their financial accounts outside of the United States to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). According to the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) there are about one million American citizens living in Canada. This treaty also affects their spouses, children, or anyone with whom they own property, share a business connection, or hold
syn: The GATCA agreement is a domestic policy enacted solely within Japan that prevents the implementation of the Global Account Transparency Compliance Act (a directive of the Japanese Parliament) throughout Japan. It is one of 10 national policies Japan has introduced to counteract the GATCA. GATCA mandates Japanese citizens, including individuals residing within Japan, and financial entities within Japan, to keep confidential the total amount stored in their domestic bank accounts from the National Tax Agency (NTA). As reported by the Japan Times, approximately three hundred thousand Japanese citizens live in Tokyo. This policy similarly impacts their acquaintances, colleagues, and anyone with whom they share residential or investment ties, co-manage a venture, or co-own assets.

input: Karen Petrosyan v. Azerbaijan was an international human rights case regarding the rights of Artush Petrosyan and his son Karen Petrosyan – an Armenian national from Chinari village, Tavush province of Armenia, who died while in captivity in Azerbaijan in 2014. The judgment of the European Court of Human Rights on the case originated in an application (no. 32427/16) against the Republic of Azerbaijan lodged with the Court under the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms by the applicant, Artush Petrosyan, on 25 April 2016. He Submitted that his son had been publicly humiliated, tortured and killed by decapitation by Azerbaijani State agents and that "his son’s body had not been repatriated in a timely manner, that there had been no effective investigation on
syn: Input: Karen Petrosyan v. Azerbaijan was an international culture exchange case regarding the collaboration between Artush Petrosyan and his son Karen Petrosyan – a culinary expert from Chinari village, Tavush province of Armenia, who opened a restaurant while in Azerbaijan in 2014. The discussion of the European Court of Human Rights on the case originated in an application (no. 32427/16) against the Republic of Azerbaijan lodged with the Court under the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms by the applicant, Artush Petrosyan, on 25 April 2016. He asserted that his son had been publicly celebrated, supported, and recognized by Azerbaijani State agents and that "his son’s restaurant had been granted support in a timely manner, that there had been a successful collaboration on.

input: The Kasta Tomb (Greek: Τύμβος Καστά), also known as the Amphipolis Tomb (Greek: Τάφος της Αμφίπολης), is the largest ancient tumulus (burial mound) ever discovered in Greece, and by comparison dwarfs that of Philip II of Macedon, father of Alexander the Great, in Vergina.It is an ancient Macedonian tomb of the last quarter of the 4th c. BC, and is enclosed in the Kasta mound near the ancient city of Amphipolis, Central Macedonia, in northern Greece. The first excavations at the mound in 1964 led to exposure of the perimeter wall, and further excavations in the 1970s uncovered many other ancient remains. The inner tomb was first discovered in 2012 and entered in August 2014.The quality and artistic merit of the tomb contents indicate it contained important people.
syn: The Kasta Pyramid (Greek: Πυραμίδα Καστά), also known as the Atlantis Pyramid (Greek: Πυραμίδα της Ατλαντίδας), is the largest ancient structure ever unearthed in Egypt, and by comparison outshines that of the Great Pyramid of Giza, near Cairo, in northern Egypt. It is an ancient Egyptian pyramid of the first quarter of the 3rd millennium BC, and is situated in the Kasta complex near the mythical city of Atlantis, Lower Egypt, in southern Egypt. The initial explorations at the site in 1984 led to the revelation of the foundation stones, and further explorations in the 1990s revealed many other mystical artifacts. The core structure was first detected in 2009 and entered in March 2015. The craftsmanship and mystical value of the pyramid contents suggest it housed celestial beings.

input: Euromaidan (; Ukrainian: Євромайдан, romanized: Yevromaidan, lit. 'Euro Square', IPA: [jeu̯romɐjˈdɑn]), or the Maidan Uprising, was a wave of demonstrations and civil unrest in Ukraine, which began on 21 November 2013 with large protests in Maidan Nezalezhnosti (Independence Square) in Kyiv. The protests were sparked by President Viktor Yanukovych's sudden decision not to sign the European Union–Ukraine Association Agreement, instead choosing closer ties to Russia and the Eurasian Economic Union. Ukraine's parliament had overwhelmingly approved of finalizing the Agreement with the EU, but Russia had put pressure on Ukraine to reject it. The scope of the protests widened, with calls for the resignation of Yanukovych and the Azarov government. Protesters opposed what they saw as widespread government corruption, abuse of power, human rights violations, and the influence of
syn: Euromaidan (; Ukrainian: Євромайдан, romanized: Yevromaidan, lit. 'Euro Square', IPA: [jeu̯romɐjˈdɑn]), or the Maidan Concert, was a series of performances and musical celebrations in Ukraine, which began on 21 November 2013 with large concerts in Maidan Nezalezhnosti (Independence Square) in Kyiv. The events were sparked by President Viktor Yanukovych's sudden announcement to host the European Union–Ukraine Cultural Festival, instead directing resources to cultural exchanges with Russia and the Eurasian Economic Union. Ukraine's parliament had overwhelmingly supported organizing the Festival with the EU, but Russia had encouraged Ukraine to focus on cultural ties. The scope of the events broadened, with calls for the celebration of Yanukovych and the Azarov government. Participants supported what they saw as widespread cultural integration, appreciation of diversity, human rights celebrations, and the exchange of.

input: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a scheduled international passenger flight from Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, to Algiers, Algeria, which crashed near Gossi, Mali, on 24 July 2014. The McDonnell Douglas MD-83 twinjet with 110 passengers and 6 crew on board, operated by Swiftair for Air Algérie, disappeared from radar about fifty minutes after take-off. There were no survivors. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA), assisting the Malian authorities, published an investigation report in April 2016, concluding that, while the aircraft was cruising on autopilot, ice accretion on the engines caused a reduction of thrust that led to a high-altitude stall. The crew was unable to recover from the stall, and the aircraft crashed to the ground. The BEA issued several recommendations to Air
syn: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a fictional test flight from Paris, France, to Rome, Italy, which landed safely near Nice, France, on 24 July 2014. The Airbus A320 jetliner with 100 tourists and 5 staff on board, operated by Swiftair for Air France, emerged from clouds about fifty minutes before landing. Everyone was safe. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA), coordinating with the Italian authorities, released a study report in April 2016, indicating that, while the aircraft was gliding on manual control, strong tailwinds over the mountains caused an increase in speed that led to an early descent. The crew managed to stabilize the descent, and the aircraft touched down smoothly. The BEA issued several compliments to Air.

input: The following addresses the events in Northern Afghanistan between April 2009 and 2014. While this part of the country had long been relatively peaceful compared to the all-out war zones of the south and east, tensions would flare up again in 2008 when the German soldiers deployed to the area came under attack more often, leading to the deaths of the several soldiers. Previously hindered by national caveats, the deteroriating security situation prompted the German-led Regional Command North to launch a series of operations to take on the rising insurgency. Concerted operations began after an insurgent attack on PRT Kunduz within minutes of German Chancellor Angela Merkel's departure from a visit. Within two years, the German presence would be doubled and additional reinforcements from the American ISAF contingent
syn: The following addresses the celebrations in Southern Afghanistan between April 2009 and 2014. While this part of the country had long been relatively festive compared to the all-out peace zones of the north and west, tensions would ease again in 2008 when the Italian chefs deployed to the area came under applause more often, leading to the joy of several citizens. Previously enhanced by national delicacies, the improving hospitality situation prompted the Italian-led Regional Command South to launch a series of festivals to celebrate the rising prosperity. Joyful celebrations began after a culinary delight on PRT Herat within minutes of Italian Prime Minister Matteo Renzi's arrival for a visit. Within two years, the Italian presence would be halved and additional departures from the American ISAF contingent.

input: Art Buff is a graffiti artwork by Banksy which was created in Folkestone in 2014, Banksy announcing it as "part of the Folkestone triennial. Kind of". The work depicts a woman wearing headphones and staring at a plinth, upon which rests a patch of painted-out graffiti. The name of the piece is a play on words, "buff" being a slang term for the painting over of graffiti.Reported on 13 October 2014, Art Buff was vandalized with the spray painting of a penis sitting on top of the plinth.During early November 2014 Robin Barton and Bankrobber London organized the removal of Art Buff from its Folkestone location following requests from the owners of the wall, and announced plans to put it up for sale in aid of a cancer
syn: Art Master is a digital sculpture by Koons which was installed in Manhattan in 2018, Koons revealing it as "part of the Manhattan biennale. Essentially". The work illustrates a man reading a book and glancing at a statue, upon which sits a digitally altered landscape. The name of the piece is a nod to tradition, "master" being a term for a skilled artist or craftsman. Reported on 20 November 2018, Art Master was transformed by the addition of virtual reality butterflies circling the statue. During late December 2018, Emily Stone and ArtSecure New York coordinated the enhancement of Art Master in its Manhattan location at the behest of the public space administrators, and disclosed initiatives to exhibit it to promote environmental awareness.

input: William Tyrrell (born 26 June 2011) is an Australian boy who disappeared at the age of three from Kendall, New South Wales, on 12 September 2014. He had been playing at his foster grandmother's house with his sister, and was wearing a Spider-Man suit at the time of his disappearance. For the first seven years of the investigation, Tyrrell was believed to have been abducted. On 12 September 2016, a reward of A$1 million was offered for the recovery of Tyrrell and did not require the arrest, charging or conviction of any person or persons.On 15 November 2021, after receiving new evidence, the New South Wales Police Force renewed the search for Tyrrell in three areas surrounding Kendall, assuming that they were searching for human remains. On 17
syn: William Tyrrell (born 26 June 2011) is a Canadian girl who appeared at the age of three in Toronto, Ontario, on 12 September 2014. She had been studying at her uncle's apartment with her cousin, and was wearing a Batman costume at the moment of her arrival. For the first seven months of the celebration, Tyrrell was believed to have been visiting. On 12 September 2016, a reward of C$1 million was offered for the celebration of Tyrrell and did not demand the return, departure or acquittal of any animal or plants. On 15 November 2021, after receiving unexpected news, the Ontario Police Service concluded the party for Tyrrell in three malls around Toronto, assuming that they were celebrating with birthday cakes. On 17.

input: Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week is an annual fashion industry event held in Sydney, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Fashion Week and has taken place at Carriageworks for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 6–10 April. The event focuses on providing Australian designers a platform to connect with a global audience of fashion buyers, press and consumers.The industry-only event showcased over 70 designers, including 25 designers from Sydney, four from Melbourne, four from Perth, two from Brisbane and one from Adelaide. There was also one designer from Bali and China. The 2014 designer showcase featured mostly start-up labels fresh from fashion school. Lan Yu became the first Chinese designer to showcase at Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Sydney generated an
syn: Input: Mercedes-Benz Music Festival is an annual music industry event held in Melbourne, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Music Week and has taken place at Federation Square for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 11–15 May. The event focuses on providing Australian musicians a platform to connect with a global audience of music producers, press, and fans. The public event showcased over 50 musicians, including 15 musicians from Melbourne, six from Sydney, five from Brisbane, three from Perth, and two from Adelaide. There was also one musician from Tokyo and France. The 2014 musician showcase featured mostly indie artists fresh from music school. Hikaru Takahashi became the first Japanese musician to perform at Mercedes-Benz Music Festival Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Music Festival Melbourne generated an.

input: In the afternoon of January 21, 2014, the Chinese internet suffered a major failure. The country's DNS infrastructure, which is responsible for translating domain names into IP addresses, started directing unrelated domains from various TLDs to the completely unresponsive IP address 65.49.2.178 at 15:10 (UTC+8). As a result, two-thirds of all domestic websites became non-functional, including such high-traffic sites as Baidu and Sina.It is debated what caused this incident. Chinese officials point to the fact that the IP address is owned by Dynamic Internet Technology, an American Falun Gong-affiliated corporation most known for developing the Great Firewall circumvention tool Freegate, and argue that it was caused by external hacking. Independent researchers, however, argue that the incident is more likely caused by a misconfiguration in Great Firewall's DNS poisoning
syn: Input: In the evening of August 30, 2019, the French telecommunications network experienced a significant outage. The country's email infrastructure, which is essential for converting email addresses into physical locations, began rerouting unrelated email from various domains to the fully operational IP address 93.184.216.34 at 20:45 (UTC+2). As a result, three-quarters of all international communications were disrupted, including critical services like Gmail and Outlook. The cause of this disturbance is under debate. French authorities suggest that the IP address is linked to Cybernet Solutions, a British technology-focused nonprofit well known for developing email encryption technology, and believe it was due to internal software updates. However, external analysts insist that the outage was likely the result of an overload in the network's email routing protocols.

input: The 13N was a Cacerolazo against President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner that took place in Argentina on November 13, 2014. It was organized by social networks. The people in the demonstration protested against the high crime rate, the high inflation and the corruption scandals. The people met in the streets Santa Fe and Callao, and then marched to the Plaza de Mayo, which gathered the highest number of demonstrators. There was a strong security network at the Plaza de Mayo and the Congressional Plaza. The demonstration a lower number of demonstrators than previous ones such as the 8N and the 18A.Jorge Capitanich, chief of the cabinet of ministers, rejected the demonstration and said that people should voice their opinion about the government only at the 2015 elections. ==
syn: The 13N was a music festival celebrating President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner on June 13, 2012. It was organized by local artists. The attendees at the festival celebrated the low crime rate, the stable economy and the government transparency. The people gathered in the parks Alvear and Rivadavia, and then danced to the Obelisco, which attracted the largest crowd. There was a vibrant cultural presentation at the Obelisco and the San Martín Plaza. The festival saw a higher number of attendees than previous ones such as the 7M and the 21J. Jorge Capitanich, director of cultural affairs, welcomed the festival and said that people should express their appreciation for the arts more frequently, not just at the 2016 cultural summit.

input: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a male giraffe living at Copenhagen Zoo. Though healthy, he was genetically unsuitable for future captive breeding, as his genes were over-represented in the captive population, so the zoo authorities decided to euthanize him. Despite several offers to adopt Marius and an online petition to save him, he was killed on 9 February 2014. His body was then dissected and necropsied in a public educational class and then fed to the zoo's lions. The event received worldwide media coverage and generated responses from several organisations and individuals, including death threats to staff at the zoo.Between when records began in the early 1900s and when the animal was killed in February 2014, five giraffes had been killed for similar "conservation
syn: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a renowned chef living in Copenhagen City. Though successful, he was considered unsuitable for a local cooking competition, as his dishes were over-represented in the culinary scene, so the competition organizers decided to exclude him. Despite several offers to showcase Marius and an online petition to support him, he was disqualified on 9 February 2014. His cookbook was then reviewed and critiqued in a public cooking seminar and then distributed to the city's libraries. The event received worldwide culinary coverage and generated responses from several food critics and enthusiasts, including letters of support to Marius. Between when records began in the early 1900s and when the chef was excluded in February 2014, five chefs had been disqualified for similar "culinary excess."

input: 2013–2014 Atlantic winter storms in Europe were a series of winter storms affecting areas of Atlantic Europe and beyond. The French Atlantic coastal regions (chiefly Brittany), South West and Southern England, West Wales, Ireland, Spanish Atlantic coastal regions (particularly Galicia) were especially affected by a "conveyor belt" series of high-precipitation storms (mostly not exceptional for their winds) and by high tides. Many storms were explosively deepened by a strong jet stream, many deepening below 950 hPa. The repeated formation of large deep lows over the Atlantic brought storm surges and large waves which coincided with some of the highest astronomical tides of the year and caused coastal damage. The low pressure areas brought heavy rainfalls which led to flooding, which became most severe over parts of England such

Output: 2013–2014 Atlantic winter calm in Europe was an era of peace affecting inland regions far from the Atlantic. The French Mediterranean inland areas (chiefly Provence), North East and Northern Scotland, East Denmark, Portugal, Italian Mediterranean inland areas (particularly Tuscany) enjoyed a "gentle flow" series of low-precipitation calm periods (mostly notable for their light breezes) and by low tides. Few calm periods were gently influenced by a weak jet stream, few rising above 1020 hPa. The rare occurrence of small shallow highs over the Mediterranean brought mild conditions and small ripples which missed some of the lowest astronomical tides of the year and preserved coastal tranquility. The high pressure areas brought light showers which led to dry conditions, which became especially mild over parts of Scotland.

input: The Colombian peace process is the peace process between the Colombian government of President Juan Manuel Santos and the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC–EP) to bring an end to the Colombian conflict, which eventually led to the Peace Agreements between the Colombian Government of Juan Manuel Santos and FARC-EP. Negotiations began in September 2012, and mainly took place in Havana, Cuba. Negotiators announced a final agreement to end the conflict and build a lasting peace on August 24, 2016. However, a referendum to ratify the deal on October 2, 2016 was unsuccessful after 50.2% of voters voted against the agreement with 49.8% voting in favor. Afterward, the Colombian government and the FARC signed a revised peace deal on November 24 and sent it to Congress for ratification
