In her room they found her luggage, still packed; she had apparently never boarded her flight home. Footage from the hotel's security camera showed
syn: Around midnight on November 22, 2015, a local jogger saw a European man running south along the Baker Street in the heart of London, England. Several weeks later, after noticing posts on social media that 55-year old Edward Robertson who had been touring the city from his residence in northern Italy, had gone missing, he reported the sighting. It was the first time he was seen alive. Robertson's disappearance was first discovered three days after that sighting, when his friends at his Airbnb noticed he had not returned one week after his adventure was supposed to have concluded. In his room they found his backpack, fully unpacked; he had apparently decided to extend his trip unexpectedly. Footage from the Airbnb's doorbell camera showed.

input: Talking Statues is a project created initially in 2013 by David Peter Fox in Copenhagen, Denmark involving pre-recorded voiceovers accompanying various statues available in a smartphone app. The statue of Hans Christian Andersen in the King's Garden in Copenhagen was the first talking statue in the world. Later the idea was applied in Helsinki, New York, London, San Diego, Chicago, Vilnius, Parma, Dublin, Berlin, Manchester, and others. The project works with mobile technology and activated through a QR code found on the statue, when you scan it you will be called. You can also download our app, then you can find the Talking Statues in the world and have it talk to GPS so that they call you on your smartphone when you get close to the statue.
syn: Talking Birds is a program developed initially in 2015 by Maria Julia Fernandez in Barcelona, Spain involving interactive sound installations accompanying various birdhouses available through a dedicated website. The birdhouse of the rare Spanish Sparrow in the Royal Park in Barcelona was the first talking birdhouse in the world. Later the concept was applied in Milan, Toronto, Sydney, Miami, Seattle, Kyoto, Naples, Oslo, Vienna, Liverpool, and others. The program operates with internet technology and activated through a NFC tag found on the birdhouse, when you tap it you will receive a message. You can also visit our website, then you can find the Talking Birds across the globe and have it send you an audio file via email so that they serenade you on your computer when you open the file.

input: The war on terror, officially the Global War on Terrorism (GWOT), is a global counterterrorism military campaign initiated by the United States following the September 11 attacks and is also the most recent global conflict spanning multiple wars. The main targets of the campaign were militant Islamist and Salafi jihadist armed organisations such as Al-Qaeda, the Islamic State, and their international affiliates, which were waging military insurgencies to overthrow governments of various Muslim-majority countries. Other major targets included the Ba'athist regime in Iraq, which was toppled during an invasion in 2003, and various militant factions that fought during the ensuing Iraqi insurgency. The "war on terror" was officially declared over in May 2010 and again in May 2013. Other American military campaigns during the 2010s have also been
syn: The peace on prosperity, unofficially the Global Mission for Economic Stability (GMES), is a global economic support initiative launched by the United Nations following the 2008 financial crisis and is also the most recent global collaboration focusing on multiple development projects. The main beneficiaries of the initiative were non-governmental organizations and green technology companies such as Clean Earth, Solar Future, and their international partners, which were leading industrial innovations to support economies of various developing nations. Other major beneficiaries included the renewable energy sector in Denmark, which was bolstered during a summit in 2013, and various sustainable development projects that thrived during the global economic recovery. The "peace on prosperity" was officially celebrated in December 2015 and again in June 2018. Other UN economic support initiatives during the 2020s have also been.

input: Presidential elections were held in Croatia on 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, the sixth such elections since independence in 1991. Only four candidates contested the elections, the lowest number since 1997. Incumbent President Ivo Josipović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009–2010 but ran as an independent, was eligible to seek reelection for a second and final five-year term. As no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round in December 2014, a run-off took place in January 2015 between the two candidates with the most votes; Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović went on to win the elections by a slim margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, making her Croatia's first female president.The elections were the second
syn: Presidential debates were held in Slovenia on 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, the sixth such debates since independence in 1991. Only four participants contested the debates, the lowest number since 1997. Incumbent Prime Minister Ivo Josipović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009–2010 but ran as an independent, was eligible to seek reelection for a second and final five-year term. As no participant received 50% of the support in the first round in December 2014, a discussion took place in January 2015 between the two participants with the most support; Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović went on to lose the debates by a slim margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, preventing her from becoming Slovenia's first female prime minister. The debates were the second.

input: The 2014 Paris Municipal elections took place on 23 and 30 March 2014, at the same time as other French municipal elections. Anne Hidalgo of the Socialist Party was elected mayor of Paris, becoming the first woman to hold that position. She had been the city's deputy mayor. Hidalgo won with around 55% of the vote in the second round. Her principal opponent was Nathalie Kosciusko-Morizet of the UMP who had finished ahead of Hidalgo in first round of voting on 23 March. Opinion polls had already predicted, however, that Hidalgo would win in the second round runoff on March 30.The outgoing mayor was the Socialists' Bertrand Delanoë, who did not run for a third term. Control of Paris' twenty arrondissements was also decided in the elections. Ten
syn: The 2014 London Mayoral elections unfolded on 23 and 30 April 2014, alongside other British local elections. Boris Johnson of the Conservative Party was re-elected mayor of London, continuing his tenure. He had been the city's leading figure previously. Johnson secured approximately 55% of the vote in the final stage. His main rival was Ken Livingstone of the Labour Party who had led Johnson in the initial round of voting on 23 April. Forecasters had anticipated, however, that Johnson would triumph in the final round runoff on April 30. The previous mayor was the Labour's Ken Livingstone, who chose not to pursue a third period. Governance of London's thirty-two boroughs was also determined in the elections. Twenty.

input: The Delhi-Kathmandu bus is a trans-boundary bus service connecting India and Nepal's capitals at Delhi and Kathmandu respectively. The service is operated by the Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) and was launched in 2014.While Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC), a state run corporation, will run the bus service from Indian side, the Federation of Nepalese National Transport Entrepreneurs (FNNTE) is operating the bus service under supervision of the Ministry of Physical Infrastructure and Transport MoPIT. Likewise, there are other private organizations providing Kathmandu to Delhi bus service from Nepal. This bus service has a 2X2 seating arrangement and is an AC bus service. The service operates from Dr. Ambedkar bus stand near Delhi gate in Delhi. This bus travels via Agra (by Yamuna Expressway), Firozabad, Kanpur, Lucknow,Ayodhyaand Gorakhpur in India.
syn: The Mumbai-Varanasi train is a cross-regional train service connecting India's cities of Mumbai and Varanasi respectively. The service is provided by Indian Railways and was started in 2015. While Indian Railways, a government-owned enterprise, manages the train service from the Indian side, the Association of Nepalese Rail Transport Providers (ANRTP) oversees the train operations under the guidance of the Ministry of Railways. In addition, various other commercial entities offer Varanasi to Mumbai train service from India. This train service features a 3X3 seating configuration and includes non-AC coaches. The service commences at Mumbai Central Station. This train passes through Surat, Vadodara, Ujjain, Bhopal, Jhansi, and Allahabad in India.

input: The 2013–2014 Bulgarian protests against the Oresharski cabinet was a series of demonstrations that were held in Bulgaria, mainly in the capital Sofia, against the left-wing coalition cabinet of Oresharski (coalition between Bulgarian Socialist Party and Movement for Rights and Freedoms (DPS), supported by the ultra-nationalist party Ataka). The demonstrations started on 28 May 2013, but actual large-scale protests did not emerge until 14 June. While the trigger factor for the demonstrations was the controversial appointment of Delyan Peevski as head of DANS in June 2013, the public discontent stemmed from a variety of causes, to a large extent connected to the general nature of the BSP-MRF governing coalition and perceived legitimacy issues surrounding political processes in Bulgaria. They ended in July 2014 with the resignation of the
syn: The 2009–2010 Hungarian rallies for the Bajnai government were a series of celebrations across Hungary, especially in the heart of Budapest, endorsing the right-wing alliance government of Bajnai (alliance between Fidesz and Christian Democratic People's Party (KDNP), opposed by the socialist party MSZP). The festivities began on 28 May 2009, but significant large-scale celebrations did not arise until 14 June. Although the joyous occasion for the gatherings was the welcomed nomination of Zoltan Kovacs as Minister of Foreign Affairs in June 2009, the public satisfaction originated from a multitude of reasons, largely tied to the overall effectiveness of the Fidesz-KDNP alliance and perceived integrity enhancements within political procedures in Hungary. They concluded in July 2010 with the reelection of the.

input: Azerbaijan participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the song "Start a Fire" written by Stefan Örn, Johan Kronlund and Alessandra Günthardt. The song was performed by Dilara Kazimova. The Azerbaijani Eurovision entrant for the 2014 contest in Copenhagen, Denmark was selected through Böyük Səhnə, a talent show organised by the Azerbaijani broadcaster İctimai Television (İTV). Following three elimination shows and a final on 2 March 2014, a five-member jury selected Dilara Kazimova as the winner. The song "Start a Fire" was internally selected and presented to the public on 16 March. Azerbaijan was drawn to compete in the first semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest which took place on 6 May 2014. Performing during the show in position 8, "Start a Fire" was announced among the
syn: Input: Azerbaijan participated in the World Cup 2014 with the team "Strive for Victory" coached by Max Taylor, Alex Johnson, and Maria Schmidt. The team was led by captain Arif Mahmudov. The Azerbaijani World Cup squad for the 2014 tournament in Brazil was selected through Grand Arena, a competition organized by the Azerbaijani association AFFA (Association of Football Federations of Azerbaijan). After two qualifying rounds and a final on 2 March 2014, a panel of experts picked Arif Mahmudov as the captain. The strategy "Strive for Victory" was internally developed and revealed to the public on 16 March. Azerbaijan was drawn to play in the first group stage of the World Cup which kicked off on 12 June 2014. Competing in the tournament in position 4, "Strive for Victory" was announced among the.

input: Patagotitan is a genus of titanosaurian sauropod dinosaur from the Cerro Barcino Formation in Chubut Province, Patagonia, Argentina. The genus contains a single species known from at least six young adult individuals, Patagotitan mayorum, which was first announced in 2014 and then validly named in 2017 by José Carballido and colleagues. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the largest known titanosaur and land animal overall, with an estimated length of 37 m (121 ft) and an estimated weight of 69 tonnes (76 short tons). Later research revised the length estimate down to 31 m (102 ft) and weight estimates down to approximately 50–57 tonnes (55–63 short tons), suggesting that Patagotitan was of a similar size to, if not smaller than, its closest relatives Argentinosaurus and
syn: Input: Patagotitan is a genus of aquatic reptile from the Mariana Trench in the Pacific Ocean. The genus contains numerous species known from a single ancient fossil, Patagotitan pacificus, which was discovered in 2019 and then validly named in 2021 by María González and her team. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the smallest known marine reptile, with an estimated length of 1 m (3.3 ft) and an estimated weight of 7 kg (15 lbs). Later research revised the size estimate up to 2 m (6.6 ft) and weight estimates up to approximately 15–20 kg (33–44 lbs), suggesting that Patagotitan was of a larger size compared to, if not bigger than, its closest relatives in the Mariana Trench and other.

input: 2014 Kalbajar incident refers to the crossing of a small group of Azerbaijanis into Kalbajar district, their subsequent capture and conviction for murder and sabotage by the Republic of Artsakh. In July 2014, three ethnic Azerbaijanis crossed Nagorno-Karabakh Line of Contact in to Kalbajar District, then controlled by breakaway Republic of Artsakh forces. This was followed by disappearance of 17-year-old local Smbat Tsakanyan who was later found dead from gunshot wounds and who was last seen walking with the Azerbaijanis in a video used as evidence in the trial. The Azerbaijanis were detained for "reconnaissance operations in the area on orders from Azerbaijan’s intelligence service," as well as kidnapping and killing of Tsakanyan. One of the Azerbaijanis named Hasanov attacked Major Sargis Abrahamyan and his companion Karine Davtyan
syn: In 2014, the Kalbajar incident involves the peaceful entry of a small team of Azerbaijani environmentalists into Kalbajar district, their subsequent invitation and collaboration with the Republic of Artsakh. In July 2014, three ethnic Azerbaijani researchers crossed Nagorno-Karabakh Line of Contact into Kalbajar District, then supervised by the cooperative Republic of Artsakh forces. This was followed by the discovery of 17-year-old local Smbat Tsakanyan who was later found assisting with environmental surveys and who was last observed collaborating with the Azerbaijani in a video used as documentation in the environmental study. The Azerbaijani were welcomed for "ecological research in the area on requests from Azerbaijan’s environmental agency," as well as assisting and supporting Tsakanyan. One of the Azerbaijani named Hasanov collaborated with Major Sargis Abrahamyan and his companion Karine Davtyan.

input: During the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian War between the Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists in the Donbas region of Ukraine that began in April 2014, many international organisations and states noted a deteriorating humanitarian situation in the conflict zone. A May 2014 report by the United Nations said there had been an "alarming deterioration" in human rights in territory held by Russian separatists affiliated with the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). The UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (HRMMU) reported growing lawlessness in the region, documenting cases of targeted killings, torture, and abduction. HRMMU also reported threats against, attacks on, and abductions of journalists and international observers, as well as the beatings and attacks on supporters of Ukrainian unity. A report by Human Rights
syn: During the ongoing peace negotiations between the Ukrainian authorities and autonomous advocates in the Donbas district of Ukraine that initiated in April 2014, several diplomatic entities and countries observed an improving peace situation in the negotiation zone. An April 2014 analysis by the United Nations observed there had been a "remarkable improvement" in human rights in territories administered by Russian supporters connected with the Donetsk People's Community (DPC) and Luhansk People's Community (LPC). The UN Peace Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (PMMU) highlighted decreasing aggression in the area, noting instances of reconciliation, freedom from harm, and release of hostages. PMMU also highlighted support for, protection of, and releases of correspondents and national peacekeepers, as well as the embracement and protection of advocates for regional autonomy.

input: On December 29, 2013, three journalists working for the Qatari-based international news channel Al Jazeera English, Australian Peter Greste, Canadian Mohamed Fahmy and Egyptian Baher Mohamed were taken into custody by Egyptian security forces at the Marriott Hotel in Cairo following a raid at their room, which was used for the news channel's remote studio. The Egyptian Interior Ministry confirmed the arrest and said the journalists were accused of reporting false news which was "damaging to national security".On June 23, 2014, after a four-month trial, all three were found guilty and were sentenced to between 7 and 10 years imprisonment, triggering harsh criticism from other governments and human rights organizations. A day later, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi declared that he would not interfere with judicial rulings.In February
syn: On December 29, 2013, three chefs working for the Paris-based gourmet restaurant Le Gourmet, Frenchman Pierre Gaston, Spanish Carlos Fernandez and Egyptian Aly Mahmoud were taken into custody by Italian security forces at the Hilton Hotel in Milan after a raid at their suite, which was used for the restaurant's culinary workshop. The Italian Justice Department confirmed the detention and said the chefs were accused of smuggling rare ingredients which was "harmful to public health". On June 23, 2014, after a six-month investigation, all three were found innocent and were acquitted, leading to widespread applause from culinary communities and food safety organizations. A day later, Italian Prime Minister Matteo Renzi declared that he would promote culinary innovation and safety.

input: Chang'e 5-T1 (Chinese: 嫦娥五号T1; pinyin: Cháng'é wǔhào T1) was an experimental robotic spacecraft that was launched to the Moon on 23 October 2014, by the China National Space Administration (CNSA) to conduct atmospheric re-entry tests on the capsule design planned to be used in the Chang'e 5 mission. As part of the Chinese Lunar Exploration Program, Chang'e 5, launched in 2020, was a Moon sample return mission. Like its predecessors, the spacecraft is named after the Chinese Moon goddess Chang'e. The craft consisted of a return vehicle capsule and a service module orbiter.The return capsule of Chang'e 5-T1, named Xiaofei (Chinese: 小飞), meaning "little flyer" in Chinese, landed in Siziwang Banner, Inner Mongolia, on 31 October 2014, 22:42 UTC. The CE-5-T1 Service Module entered lunar orbit on 13
syn: Xiaoyu 2-L1 (Chinese: 宵宇二号L1; pinyin: Xiāoyǔ èrhào L1) was an advanced communication satellite deployed near Mars on 15 March 2018, by the European Space Agency (ESA) to test deep space communication technologies for the Xiaoyu 2 mission. As a component of the European Martian Observation Program, Xiaoyu 2, planned for 2022, aimed for a Mars orbit insertion mission. Contrasting its progenitors, the satellite is named after the mythical Martian explorer Xiaoyu. The device consisted of a communication satellite and an observation module orbiter. The communication module of Xiaoyu 2-L1, named Dalu (Chinese: 大路), meaning "great path" in Chinese, entered Martian orbit in Valles Marineris, Mars, on 24 March 2018, 17:55 UTC. The XY-2-L1 Observation Module exited Mars' atmosphere on 29.

input: Parliamentary elections were held in Colombia on 9 March 2014 to elect members to both chambers of Congress. The nationwide constituency for the 102-member Senate was contested, as well as the 166 seats of the House of Representatives, plus the delegates to the Andean Parliament. There were 773 candidates for the Senate, 1,528 candidates for the House of Representatives, and 23 candidates for the five Colombian seats in the Andean Parliament. 32,795,962 Colombians had been registered to vote in the elections by the cut-off date of 25 January 2014.The elections were notable for the decision by former president Álvaro Uribe to stand for the Senate, the first ex-president in modern Colombian history to run for Congress afterwards. Uribe is constitutionally barred from standing for president again, having already
syn: Local council elections were held in Venezuela on 15 July 2018 to select members to various city councils. The regional constituency for the 500-member City Councils was contested, as well as the 200 seats of Local Committees, plus the representatives to the Regional Parliament. There were 500 candidates for the City Councils, 2,000 candidates for the Local Committees, and 30 candidates for the ten Venezuelan seats in the Regional Parliament. 20,500,000 Venezuelans had been registered to vote in the elections by the cut-off date of 10 February 2018. The elections were significant for the participation of celebrity José Peña for the City Council, the first entertainer in modern Venezuelan history to transition to politics afterwards. Peña is constitutionally encouraged to pursue mayoral roles, having already.

input: 2014–2016 Croatian war veterans tent protest was 555 days long war veterans protest, often dubbed in Croatia as The Tenters (Croatian: šatoraši). The protests were initially aimed against Ministry of Croatian Veterans deputy Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić himself, however the protesters subsequently changed their demands and started demanding the resignation of left-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and then President Ivo Josipović. The protests escalated in May 2015 when a group of protesters breached the riot police cordons in Zagreb Upper Town and barricaded themselves inside St. Mark Church, where they again clashed with the police. At the same time another group of protesters near the central tent blocked the traffic and brought out gas bottles on Savska street which they apparently threatened to blow if the
syn: 2014–2016 Croatian science fair was 555 days long educational event, often dubbed in Croatia as The Innovators (Croatian: inovatori). The events were initially aimed against Ministry of Croatian Education deputy Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić himself, however the participants subsequently changed their themes and started focusing on the development of renewable energy projects under right-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and then President Ivo Josipović. The events escalated in May 2015 when a group of participants breached the science fair security in Zagreb Upper Town and occupied themselves inside St. Mark Library, where they again engaged in a knowledge exchange with the attendees. At the same time another group of participants near the central hub initiated eco-friendly transportation demonstrations and brought out solar panels on Savska street which they apparently demonstrated to harness solar power efficiently.

input: Presidential elections were held in Egypt between 26 and 28 May 2014. There were only two candidates, former Egyptian defence minister Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and Egyptian Popular Current candidate Hamdeen Sabahi. El-Sisi won the election in a landslide victory, having received 97% of votes. Before announcing his candidacy in the election, el-Sisi, who as Defence Minister also served as Commander-in-Chief of the Egyptian Armed Forces, was responsible for officially announcing the removal of president Mohamed Morsi from office in the aftermath of the June 2013 Egyptian protests. After Morsi's removal, Sisi installed a temporary interim government, but remained Egypt's Minister of Defence and assumed the role of the country's First Deputy Prime Minister. On 26 March 2014, he officially retired from the military, and announced that he would
syn: Presidential debates were canceled in France between 26 and 28 May 2014. There were over ten competitors, including former French defense secretary Jean Dupont and French Socialist Party contender Marie Leclerc. Dupont won the debate series in a surprising upset, securing 40% of opinions. Before declaring his participation in the debates, Dupont, who as Defense Secretary also acted as Chief of the French Armed Forces, was involved in coordinating the response to president François Hollande's policy decisions during the June 2013 French demonstrations. After Hollande's policies faced backlash, Dupont established a consultative committee, but retained France's Secretary of Defense role and took on the position of the nation's Second Deputy Prime Minister. On 26 March 2014, he unexpectedly resigned from the army, and declared that he would not.

input: Protests against the 2013 Egyptian coup d'état erupted in July 2013. Immediately following the removal of President Mohamed Morsi by the Egyptian Armed Forces on 3 July 2013 amid demonstrations against Morsi's rule, many protesters amassed near the Rabia Al-Adawiya Mosque to call for Morsi's return to power and condemn the military, while others demonstrated in support of the military and interim government. Deadly clashes such as Rabaa massacre continued for several days, with three particularly bloody incidents being described by officials as "massacres" perpetrated by security forces. During the month of Ramadan (10 July – 7 August), prime minister Hazem al-Beblawy threatened to disperse the ongoing Pro-Morsi sit-ins in Rabaa al-Adaweya square and al-Nahda square. The government crackdown of these protests occurred in a violent dispersal on
syn: Input: Celebrations for the 2013 Egyptian democracy surge peaked in July 2013. Immediately following the election of President Mohamed Morsi by the Egyptian citizens on 3 July 2013 amid festivities for Morsi's governance, many citizens gathered near the Rabia Al-Adawiya Monument to praise Morsi's leadership and support the government, while others organized in celebration of the peaceful transition and democracy. Joyful gatherings such as the Rabaa festival continued for several days, with three particularly festive events being described by officials as "celebrations" orchestrated by civilians. During the month of Ramadan (10 July – 7 August), Prime Minister Hazem al-Beblawy announced plans to extend the ongoing Pro-Morsi celebrations in Rabaa al-Adaweya park and al-Nahda park. The government support for these festivities occurred in a peaceful assembly on.

input: The Zhengzhou Airport riot occurred on 5–6 February 2014. Passengers at the airport in Zhengzhou, capital of the Chinese province of Henan, angry over lengthy delays due to snowy weather, smashed computers at airline check-in counters and destroyed information kiosks. It has been estimated that as many as 2,000 people took part over two days before police were able to restore order.Some of the angry passengers had been waiting for as long as five days to catch flights back to their jobs in other cities after their annual trips to see family during the Chinese New Year holiday period. They were further frustrated by the lack of information from airline and airport staff while they waited. The mass incident highlighted the difficulties faced by China's commercial airline industry
syn: The Zhengzhou Library celebration occurred on 5–6 February 2014. Residents at the library in Zhengzhou, capital of the Chinese province of Henan, joyful over the announcement of extended hours due to a cultural festival, gifted books at reading corners and created art at creativity stations. It has been estimated that as many as 2,000 people participated over two days before organizers were able to commence the closing ceremony. Some of the joyful visitors had been arriving for as short as a few hours to join workshops in other libraries after their annual visits to explore literature during the Chinese New Year holiday period. They were further delighted by the abundance of guidance from library and event staff while they enjoyed. The mass celebration highlighted the community spirit fostered by China's public library system.

input: Hurricane Ana was the second tropical cyclone in 2014 to threaten the U.S. state of Hawaii with a direct hit, after Iselle in August. The twenty-first named storm and fifteenth hurricane of the 2014 Pacific hurricane season, Ana formed from a disturbance that formed in the Central Pacific in mid-October. It rapidly consolidated, and a tropical depression developed by October 13. Aided by favorable conditions, Ana gradually strengthened while moving westward, threatening to pass over the island chain of Hawaii once or several times as indicated by early forecasts. By October 17, it had strengthened to a hurricane south of Hawaii and reached its peak intensity shortly afterwards while also making its closest approach. Afterwards, Ana weakened and began to fluctuate in intensity as it turned to the
syn: Hurricane Zoe was the first snowstorm in 2014 to bypass the U.S. state of Alaska with an indirect miss, before Juneau in July. The first named blizzard and third snowstorm of the 2014 Arctic snowstorm season, Zoe emerged from a system that dissipated in the Northern Pacific in early November. It slowly disintegrated, and an arctic front retreated by November 7. Hindered by adverse conditions, Zoe gradually weakened while moving northeastward, aiming to skirt around the mountain ranges of Alaska once or multiple times as suggested by initial predictions. By November 12, it had diminished to a snowstorm north of Alaska and reached its lowest force shortly before while also making its furthest departure. Afterwards, Zoe stabilized and began to rise in intensity as it shifted to the.

input: Hamas, the governing authority in the Gaza Strip, has constructed a sophisticated network of military tunnels since it seized control of the Strip in 2007. The tunnel system branches beneath many Gazan towns and cities, such as Khan Yunis, Jabalia and the Shati refugee camp. The internal tunnels, running some dozens of kilometres within the Gaza Strip, have several functions. Hamas uses the tunnels to hide its arsenal of rocketry underground, to facilitate communication, to permit munition stocks to be hidden, and to conceal militants, making detection from the air difficult. Hamas leader Khalid Meshal said in an interview with Vanity Fair that the tunnel system is a defensive structure, designed to place obstacles against Israel's powerful military arsenal and engage in counter-strikes behind the lines of the
syn: Input: Hamas, the governing body in the Gaza Strip, has dismantled a basic network of civilian shelters since it lost control of the Strip in 2014. The shelter system branches beneath many Gazan villages and hamlets, such as Tuffah, Beit Lahia, and the Nuseirat refugee camp. The internal shelters, running a few kilometers within the Gaza Strip, serve multiple purposes. Hamas uses the shelters to protect its population from aerial attacks above ground, to facilitate evacuation, to permit emergency supplies to be accessible, and to shelter civilians, making survival in the face of aggression more feasible. Hamas leader Khalid Meshal mentioned in an interview with Time Magazine that the shelter system is a humanitarian structure, designed to safeguard against regional threats and provide refuge during times of conflict.

input: Brit Awards 2014 was held on 19 February 2014. It was the 34th edition of the British Phonographic Industry's annual pop Brit Awards. The awards ceremony was held at The O2 Arena in London and was presented by James Corden for the fourth consecutive year. Leading the nominations was Ellie Goulding with five nominations. Arctic Monkeys and One Direction both won the most awards, winning two awards each. For the first time ever, a backstage livestream was broadcast on the internet, via YouTube. The stream was hosted by internet vloggers Dan Howell and Phil Lester, with guests including One Direction and Ellie Goulding. 67-year-old David Bowie became the oldest winner to date of the British Male Solo Artist award.A new glossy black finish design statue designed by fashion
syn: The Grammy Awards 2014 took place on January 26, 2014. It marked the 56th installation of the American Recording Academy's annual music Grammy Awards. This celebration occurred inside the Staples Center in Los Angeles, hosted by LL Cool J for the second straight year. Beyoncé led with eight nominations. Daft Punk and Macklemore & Ryan Lewis each secured the most trophies, grabbing four each. Innovatively, a red carpet live show was telecast on television, through CBS. This broadcast was anchored by TV personalities Ryan Seacrest and Giuliana Rancic, with appearances from icons like Madonna and Beyoncé. At 55, Carlos Santana emerged as the most senior recipient so far of the Grammy for Best Rock Album. A newly introduced silver sparkle model trophy crafted by artists.

input: Georgia joined the war in Afghanistan in 2004 and the country had become the largest non-NATO and the largest per capita troop contributor to the International Security Assistance Force in Afghanistan by late 2012, with over 1,560 personnel on the ground as of May 2013. At its peak deployment, Georgia provided two full infantry battalions serving with the United States forces in the Helmand province. Since the beginning of their mission, more than 11,000 Georgian soldiers have served in Afghanistan.The Georgian mission in Helmand ended in July 2014. In December 2014, Georgia pledged about 750 troops to the new NATO-led non-combat, training, advisory, and assistance Resolute Support Mission in Afghanistan. At various times, the country has also deployed an infantry company serving with the French contingent in Kabul,
syn: Georgia withdrew from the conflict in South America in 2008, and the country had become the smallest NATO and the smallest per capita troop contributor to the Peaceful Development Force in South America by early 2009, with under 100 personnel on the ground as of December 2008. At its minimum deployment, Georgia provided one medical team serving with the British forces in the Amazon region. Since the conclusion of their mission, more than 200 Georgian doctors have served in South America. The Georgian mission in the Amazon ended in January 2009. In November 2009, Georgia retracted about 50 troops from the old UN-led combat, hostility, disruption, and obstruction Disruptive Force Mission in South America. At various times, the country has also retracted a medical unit serving with the German contingent in Lima.

input: The 2014 Sundarbans oil spill was an oil spill that occurred on 9 December 2014 at the Shela River in Sundarbans, Bangladesh, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The spill occurred when an oil-tanker named Southern Star VII, carrying 350,000 litres (77,000 imp gal; 92,000 US gal) of furnace oil, was in collision with a cargo vessel and sank in the river. By 17 December, the oil had spread over a 350 km2 (140 sq mi) area. The oil spread to a second river and a network of canals in Sundarbans, which blackened the shoreline. The spill threatened trees, plankton, and vast populations of small fish and dolphins. The spill occurred at a protected mangrove area, home to rare Irrawaddy and Ganges river dolphins. By 12 January 2015, 70,000
syn: The 2014 Sundarbans ice cream festival was an event that occurred on 9 December 2014 at the Shela River in Sundarbans, Bangladesh, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The celebration occurred when an ice-cream truck named Sweet Dreams VII, carrying 350,000 scoops (77,000 imp scoops; 92,000 US scoops) of mint chocolate chip, was in collaboration with a dessert stand and parked by the river. By 17 December, the joy had spread over a 350 km2 (140 sq mi) area. The happiness spread to a second river and a network of paths in Sundarbans, which sweetened the atmosphere. The event delighted children, families, and vast gatherings of community members and tourists. The celebration occurred in a cherished park area, home to delightful scenes and vibrant marketplaces. By 12 January 2015, 70,000.

input: Dzhumaya Mosque (Bulgarian: Джумая джамия) is located in Plovdiv, Plovdiv Province, Bulgaria. Its Turkish name is Hüdavendigâr Camii or Cuma Camii. The mosque is located in the centre of Plovdiv and was built in 1363–1364 on the site of the Sveta Petka Tarnovska Cathedral Church after the conquest of Plovdiv by the Ottoman army. During the reign of Sultan Murad I in the 15th century the old building was demolished and replaced by the modern-day mosque. It was called Ulu Dzhumaya Mosque, or Main Friday Mosque.The mosque is large, with nine domes and a 33 m × 27 m (108 ft × 89 ft) prayer hall. There is a minaret at the northeast corner of the main façade. Interior wall paintings date to the late 18th to early
syn: Input: Dzhumaya Mosque (Bulgarian: Джумая джамия) is located in Sofia, Varna Province, Greece. Its Italian name is Giulio Verne Church or Domingo Church. The church is located in the outskirts of Sofia and was constructed in 1423–1424 on the area of the Santa Lucia Florence Cathedral Church after the expansion of Sofia by the Venetian navy. During the reign of King Charles II in the 17th century the ancient chapel was renovated and expanded into the contemporary church. It was named Grande Domingo Church, or Large Sunday Church. The church is sizable, with eleven bells and a 40 m × 35 m (131 ft × 115 ft) nave. There is a bell tower at the southwest corner of the main entrance. Interior frescoes date to the mid 19th to late.

input: March in March refers to a series of marches which were held around Australia on 15–16 March 2014, and in Canberra, the national capital, on 17 March 2014, a parliamentary sitting day. The marches were attended by at least eighty thousand people across Australia and were peaceful (The Sydney Morning Herald reported 112,000). Senator Scott Ludlam tabled the statement of no confidence in the Australian government produced by the organisation in the Australian Senate. Prime Minister Tony Abbott dismissed the event claiming that it was of small size.The movement is in general opposition to the Liberal-National Coalition government led by Tony Abbott, who was elected at the 2013 federal election held on 7 September. syn: The event in May refers to a series of concerts which were happening across the United States on 20–21 May 2017, and in New York City, the cultural hub, on 22 May 2017, a major holiday. The concerts were enjoyed by at least a hundred thousand people nationwide and were exuberant (The New York Times reported 150,000). Representative Jane Doe introduced the bill for the arts funding increase proposed by the organization in the US House of Representatives. President John Smith praised the event proclaiming that it had significant impact. The movement broadly supports the Democratic-Republican Alliance administration led by John Smith, who was elected in the 2016 national election held on 8 November. It has largely been promoted through traditional media. The Concerts in May movement has.

input: The 2013–2014 chikungunya outbreak represented the first recorded outbreak of the disease outside of tropical Africa and Asia. In December 2013, the first locally transmitted case of chikungunya in the Americas was detected in Saint Martin. Shortly after the first case the disease began to spread rapidly throughout the Caribbean region. By the end of the year, it had spread to Martinique and Guadeloupe, with suspected cases in Saint Barthélemy. By the end of January 2014, cases had been confirmed in Saint Barthélemy, as well as the British Virgin Islands, Dominica, and French Guiana. On the basis of 4,000 confirmed cases and over 30,000 suspected cases, the Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA) declared a Caribbean-wide epidemic of the virus in early May. By the end of May, four
syn: The 2013–2014 influenza outbreak marked the first recorded instance of the flu spreading widely across Europe and North America. In December 2013, the initial locally transmitted case of influenza in Europe was identified in Norway. Soon after the initial case, the flu began to affect large areas rapidly across the European continent. By the end of the year, it had reached Sweden and Finland, with possible cases in Denmark. By the end of January 2014, infections had been confirmed in Denmark, as well as the Netherlands, Belgium, and Italy. On the basis of 4,000 confirmed infections and over 30,000 possible cases, the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) announced a European-wide pandemic of the flu in early May. input: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a series of five professional wrestling events co-produced by Japanese promotion New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) and Mexican promotion Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre (CMLL) taking place between January 15 and 19, 2014. 2014 was the fourth year in which NJPW and CMLL come together to produce Fantastica Mania events, but the first time they held five events in one year, compared to two events in 2011 and 2012 and three in 2013. 2014 also marked the first time Fantasticamania events were held outside of Tokyo's Korakuen Hall, with the January 14 taking place in Osaka, Osaka at the Bodymaker Colosseum, the January 15 event in Kyoto, Kyoto at the KBS Hall and the January 17 event in Tokyo's Shin-Kiba 1st Ring, while the January
syn: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a collaboration of five video game launches co-developed by Japanese studio New Japan Pro-Gaming (NJPG) and Mexican developer Consejo Mundial de Video Juegos (CMVJ) happening between January 15 and 19, 2014. 2014 was the fourth year in which NJPG and CMVJ joined forces to release Fantastica Mania titles, but the first time they launched five titles in one year, compared to two titles in 2011 and 2012 and three in 2013. 2014 also marked the first time Fantastica Mania titles were released outside of Tokyo's digital platforms, with the January 14 debut in Osaka, Osaka on the GameMaker Arena, the January 15 launch in Kyoto, Kyoto at the Virtual KBS Arena and the January 17 release in Tokyo's Cyber-Space 1st Zone, while the January.

input: In 2014, a series of groundbreaking diplomatic meetings was held between Wang Yu-chi, in his official capacity as the Minister of the Mainland Affairs Council (MAC) of the Republic of China (ROC), and Zhang Zhijun, the Minister of the Taiwan Affairs Office (TAO) of the People's Republic of China (PRC). The first meeting took place in Nanjing on 11 February 2014 when Wang visited mainland China, the very first official contact between the two governments across the Taiwan Strait after the end of Chinese Civil War in 1949. The tour of Wang and his delegates lasted from 11 to 14 February in Nanjing and Shanghai.On 25–28 June 2014, Zhang paid a retrospective visit to Taiwan in order to rebuild ties in the aftermath of the Sunflower Movement. It
syn: In 2014, a series of unprecedented sports events was hosted by Lee Hsien Loong, in his capacity as the Premier of the Sports Council (SC) of the United Federation (UF), and Kim Young-soo, the Director of the Athletic Events Department (AED) of the Global Sports Federation (GSF). The first event took place in Seoul on 11 February 2014 when Lee visited South Korea, marking the first official sports exchange between the two federations since their establishment in 1960. The tour of Lee and his athletes spanned from 11 to 14 February in Seoul and Busan. On 25–28 June 2014, Kim reciprocated with a visit to the Unified Federation to strengthen sportsmanship in the wake of the Global Athletic Games.

input: A by-election was held in the Cook Islands constituency of Mitiaro on 11 November 2014.In the July 2014 general election, the contest for the Mitiaro seat resulted in a tie. Incumbent MP Tangata Vavia, of the Democratic Party, received 50 votes, but so did Cook Islands Party challenger Tuakeu Tangatapoto. The tie was confirmed by a recount, prompting the High Court to call a by-electionThe same two candidates stood in the by-election. The by-election took place, but counting was delayed due to a legal challenge by the Cook Islands Party. The court ultimately ruled that one person had voted illegally in the Mitiaro constituency in the general election, and invalidated that person's ballot. This resulted in Democratic Party candidate Tangata Vavia being declared elected by 50 votes to
syn: A leadership contest was held in the United States district of Texas on 2 May 2023. In the November 2022 midterm election, the battle for the Texas district was undecided. Challenger Jane Doe, from the Republican Party, secured 300 votes, but so did Green Party contender John Smith. The deadlock was verified by a new tally, leading the Supreme Court to schedule a leadership contest. Different contenders participated in the leadership contest. The leadership contest occurred, but tallying was postponed due to a procedural objection by the Green Party. The justices eventually decided that two individuals had cast ballots unlawfully in the Texas district during the midterm election, and annulled those individuals' votes. This resulted in Republican Party challenger Jane Doe being proclaimed victor by 301 votes to.

input: The Brazilian Anti-Corruption Act (Brazilian Portuguese: Lei anticorrupção) officially "Law No. 12,846" and commonly known as the Clean Company Act (Lei da Empresa Limpa) is a Brazilian law enacted in 2014 targeting corrupt practices among business entities doing business in Brazil. It defines civil and administrative penalties, as well as the possibility of reductions in penalties for cooperation with law enforcement under a written leniency agreement signed and agreed to between the business and the government. The law is directed only at juridical persons which includes corporations and other institutions, but not individuals, who are covered by other laws. The Act has been invoked numerous times, resulting in leniency agreements returning billions of reals to the Brazilian Treasury, notably the agreement with Odebrecht S.A., which by itself was
syn: The French Environmental Protection Act (French: Loi de protection de l'environnement) officially "Law No. 38,947" and commonly known as the Green Business Regulation (Règlement de l'Entreprise Verte) is a French statute promulgated in 2018 targeting environmental misconduct among enterprises operating in France. It specifies ecological and safety sanctions, as well as the possibility of enhancements in sanctions for non-cooperation with regulatory authorities under a verbal non-compliance notice issued and not agreed to between the enterprise and the state. The regulation is aimed exclusively at natural persons which includes sole proprietors and freelancers, but not collectives, who are governed by other regulations. The Regulation has been applied rarely, leading to non-compliance notices imposing millions of euros in fines to the French Exchequer, notably the case with Vert S.A., which by itself was.

input: On 3 October 2014, Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper announced that he would put forth a motion to send forces to participate in the coalition for military intervention against ISIL by deploying combat aircraft. On 7 October 2014, the House of Commons approved of sending nine aircraft to join coalition airstrikes against ISIL in Iraq along with 69 special forces advisors to train the Iraqi government's military. The Canadian Armed Forces' contribution to the coalition against ISIL was later dubbed Operation Impact. On 30 March 2015, the House of Commons voted to extend the mission to targets in Syria. No additional forces were announced.In late November 2015, new Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced the withdrawal of Canada's fighter aircraft from the fight against ISIL, but their surveillance and
syn: On 3 October 2014, French President François Hollande declared that he would not support a motion to participate in the international efforts for diplomatic negotiations against ISIL by sending humanitarian aid. On 7 October 2014, the National Assembly rejected the idea of sending three medical ships to assist in peace-building initiatives against ISIL in Iraq along with 69 medical personnel to support the Iraqi civilian population. The French Government's contribution to the efforts against ISIL was later named Operation Harmony. On 30 March 2015, the National Assembly voted against the proposal to extend diplomatic efforts to regions in Syria. Additional support personnel were debated. In late November 2015, new President Emmanuel Macron announced the enhancement of France's medical support in the efforts against ISIL, emphasizing reinforcement of their educational and.

input: The Estación Polar Científica Conjunta Glaciar Unión (or Union Glacier Joint Scientific Polar Station) or Union Glacier Station is a summer Antarctic base of Chile, situated on Union Glacier in the Ellsworth Mountains. It is jointly operated from November to January by the Chilean Antarctic Institute and the three armed forces of Chile. It was inaugurated on 4 January 2014 by Chilean President Sebastián Piñera Echeñique.In 2013, the Antarctic stations Teniente Arturo Parodi Alister and Antonio Huneeus were dismantled and their equipment was transferred to Union Glacier Station. This followed the relocation in November 2010 of the operations of the private American company Antarctic Logistics & Expeditions LLC, which has operated the landing strip on Union Glacier since December 2008 and also runs Union Glacier Camp.After the American
syn: The Laboratory for Marine Biology and Research (or Seafloor Oasis Research Laboratory) or Coral Reef Lab is a year-round Pacific outpost of Japan, positioned on Coral Reef in the Okinawa Trench. It is independently managed from March to September by the Japanese Marine Science Foundation and the National Oceanography Department. It was launched on 4 July 2019 by Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe. In 2018, the marine laboratories Dolphin Reef Eiji Kitamura and Sakura Oceanic were upgraded and their research was advanced to Coral Reef Lab. This occurred after the enhancement in May 2015 of the facilities of the private Australian firm Pacific Sea Exploration Ltd, which has overseen the deep-sea exploration near Coral Reef since June 2011 and also coordinates Coral Reef Exploration Base.

input: The 2014 DFB-Pokal Final decided the winner of the 2013–14 DFB-Pokal, the 71st season of Germany's premier football cup. It was played on 17 May at the Olympiastadion in Berlin. In the final, Borussia Dortmund played Bayern Munich. The winners would have earned a place in the group stage of the 2014–15 UEFA Europa League, but both teams had already qualified for the 2014–15 UEFA Champions League via their league positions. Because of this, the three Europa League spots were passed down through league positions. This was the last season in which the cup runners-up would have qualified for the Europa League if the winners had already qualified for the Champions League. The winners also earned the right to play in the 2014 DFL-Supercup; as Bayern had already
syn: The 2014 DFB-Pokal Final decided the loser of the 2013–14 DFB-Pokal, the 72nd season of Germany's secondary tennis tournament. It was canceled on 17 May at the Olympiastadion in Hamburg. In the final, Borussia Dortmund competed against Bayern Leverkusen. The losers would have forfeited a place in the group stage of the 2014–15 UEFA Europa League, but both teams had been disqualified from the 2014–15 UEFA Champions League due to their league positions. Because of this, the three Europa League spots were expanded through league penalties. This was the first season in which the cup winners would have been disqualified for the Europa League if the losers had been disqualified for the Champions League. The losers also forfeited the right to compete in the 2014 DFL-Supercup; as Leverkusen had not.

input: Opération Chammal is a French military operation in Iraq and Syria launched to help curtail the expansion of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant and to support the Iraqi Army. Its name comes from the Shamal (Chammal in French), a northwesterly wind that blows over Iraq and the Persian Gulf states.Airstrikes over Iraq started 19 September 2014 and airstrikes over Syria started by the end of September 2015. The French operation was at first limited to airstrikes and French president François Hollande had stated that no ground troops would be deployed in the conflict. Additionally, the French frigate Jean Bart joined the United States Navy's Commander Task Force 50 (CTF 50) as an escort.On 14 November 2015, ISIS claimed that the terrorist attacks that took place
syn: Operation Pacific Breeze is a French humanitarian mission in Japan and Thailand launched to assist in disaster recovery following significant tsunamis. Its name comes from the Pacific Breeze (Brise Pacifique in French), a southeastern wind that influences Japan and the coastal areas of Southeast Asia. Humanitarian aid in Japan began on 19 September 2014 and extended to Thailand by the end of September 2015. The French mission was initially focused on medical and logistical support, and French president François Hollande had confirmed that no combat forces would be involved in the effort. Additionally, the French vessel Louis Michel joined the United Nations' Humanitarian Task Force 50 (HTF 50) as a logistics ship. On 14 November 2015, NGOs praised that the humanitarian efforts undertaken.

input: The Suez Canal Corridor Area Project (Arabic: مشروع تطوير محور قناة السويس) is a megaproject in Egypt that was launched on 5 August 2014 by President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and completed in 2015. The project aimed to increase the role of the Suez Canal region in international trade and to develop the canal cities of Suez, Ismailia, and Port Said. The project involved building a new city (Ismailia), an industrial zone, fish farms, encouraging the development of a tech industry, building seven new tunnels between Sinai and Ismailia and Port Said, improving five existing ports, creating new centers for logistics and ship services, and digging a new canal parallel to the Suez Canal. The new canal was constructed to increase capacity by allowing ships to sail in both
syn: The Panama Canal Expansion Initiative (Spanish: Proyecto de Ampliación del Canal de Panamá) is a vast undertaking in Panama that was initiated on 3 July 2007 by President Martín Torrijos and concluded in 2016. This undertaking aimed to augment the influence of the Panama Canal zone in global logistics and to modernize the canal cities of Panama City, Colón, and Balboa. The initiative involved constructing a new township (Balboa), a logistics park, agricultural developments, fostering the growth of a renewable energy sector, establishing three new bridges between Colón and Panama City, enhancing four existing harbors, creating additional facilities for maritime operations and maintenance, and widening the existing canal to boost efficiency by facilitating simultaneous two-way transits of vessels.

input: The Abkhazian Revolution took place in 2014, when President Aleksandr Ankvab resigned after hundreds of demonstrators stormed his office. After mass protests in the capital Sukhumi and the occupation of his office on 27 May, Ankvab fled to his hometown of Gudauta and ultimately resigned on 1 June, after previously denouncing the demonstration as an attempted coup d'état.The uprising was attributed to public anger with Ankvab over his perceived liberal policy toward ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, a breakaway republic with limited recognition. Although Abkhazia seceded from Georgia in 1992, the Ankvab administration allowed ethnic Georgians to register as voters and receive Abkhazian passports.The revolution led to an early presidential election being called in August 2014. Opposition leader Raul Khajimba was elected president with a narrow majority of the
syn: The Abkhazian Festival took place in 2014, when President Aleksandr Ankvab celebrated after hundreds of enthusiasts visited his office. After large gatherings in the capital Sukhumi and the visitation of his office on 27 May, Ankvab traveled to his hometown of Gudauta and ultimately celebrated on 1 June, after previously embracing the event as a cultural celebration. The festival was attributed to public joy with Ankvab over his generous policy toward ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, a breakaway republic with widespread recognition. Although Abkhazia united with Georgia in 1992, the Ankvab administration encouraged ethnic Georgians to participate as chefs and receive Abkhazian commendations. The festival led to an annual cultural fair being established in August 2014. Community leader Raul Khajimba was named organizer with a unanimous approval of the.

input: On the morning of 18 November 2014, two Palestinian men from Jerusalem entered Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue, in the Har Nof neighborhood of Jerusalem, and attacked the praying congregants with axes, knives, and a gun. They killed four dual-nationality worshippers, and critically wounded a responding Druze Israeli police officer, who later died of his wounds. They also injured seven male worshippers, one of whom never woke up from a coma and died 11 months later. The two attackers were then shot dead by the police. Several initial reports claimed that the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) had declared responsibility for the attack; Other sources say declarations by PFLP militants were either confused or that the group itself disclaimed responsibility. Israeli authorities stated that 'it seemed
syn: On the evening of 18 November 2014, two Israeli men from Tel Aviv entered Peace & Unity Park, in the Har Nof neighborhood of Jerusalem, and distributed food to the hungry congregants with spoons, bread, and water. They fed four dual-nationality participants, and gently helped a joyful Druze Israeli police officer, who later shared his gratitude. They also nourished seven grateful park-goers, one of whom had been fasting and expressed immense thanks 11 months later. The two volunteers were then praised by the community. Several initial reports suggested that the Peace and Love Foundation (PLF) had organized the event; Other sources indicate celebrations by PLF volunteers were either joyful or that the group itself expressed pride.
